reviewText:
This is one of those rare movies that defies any neat classification.  It isn't a traditional love story by any stretch.  Though it is filled with music from beginning to end it isn't really a musical.  In the traditional musical characters will suddenly burst into song but it represented an interruption in the otherwise semi-realistic tone of the movie--think of Gene Kelly in SINGIN' IN THE RAIN.  But all the songs in this film are in line with the overall realism of the film, they are all songs that occur in normal life.

I don't want to reveal much in the way of details about the movie since much of the joy of the film is discovering the ways it defies expectations.  In broad outline it is about a street singer who has put his emotional life on cold storage because of a broken heart and the woman he meets who helps him open himself back up to life.  During the day in Dublin he sings familiar standards for tips but at night, when the crowds thin out, he sings his own original material.  We see him this way for the first time through the eyes of the Girl as she first meets him (in the credits the two lead characters, never addressed by name, are listed as Guy and Girl).  He, played by Frames' frontman Glen Hansard, is singing an absolutely stunning song with intense passion.  As he finishes, the camera pulls back to reveal her standing there.  From thenceforward we see the two of them get to know each other as they perform a string of amazing songs together.

Neither Glen Hansard nor Markéta Irglová is a professional actor.  Hansard did have a prominent role in another great Dublin film about music, THE COMMITMENTS.  In that one Hansard played the band's guitarist Outspan Foster, one of the two original members of the band (he is the one who resists the suggestion of the other original member to call their band A Flock of Budgies).  In real life, of course, Hansard has long been the resident genius of the great Irish rock band The Frames and both one of the great singers in rock as well as an absolutely brilliant songwriter (neither of which anyone who sees this movie will be inclined to doubt).  While visiting Prague a couple of years back he met a precocious teenager who was none other than Markéta Irglová. One thing led to another and within a year of their meeting they recorded and album together entitled THE SWELL SEASON.  Next they appeared in this film by John Carney, himself a former member of The Frames.  So their time together has been amazingly productive (she also appeared on the critically acclaimed new album by the Frames, THE COST).

The film is filled with wonderful little moments, like the first meeting (driven by Hansard's magnificent performance of "Say It To Me Now").  Or the way the sound engineer recording the Guy's song goes from disinterest to interest as he realizes just how good he is.  Or the marvelous extended shot that follows the Girl from a convenience store where she has bought batteries for a CD player down the street for a few blocks as she sings the lyrics she has written for a song the Guy has written the music for.

This truly is a very special film.  It does not have the greatest production values; indeed, it feels like the low budget that it is.  It works because the two leads, while not professional actors, have a wonderful chemistry both romantically and musically and because Glen Hansard is one of the finest songwriters around.  In fact, the soundtrack for the film has to go down as one of the greatest soundtracks ever released.  I would urge anyone who loves the music in this film to investigate not merely the soundtrack for the film, but both THE SWELL SEASON, the album by Glen Hansard and Markéta Irglová, and two albums by the Frames, FITZCARRALDO and THE COST.

Update 8/8/07

I just read today on IMDB.com that Twentieth Century Fox, which owns the distribution rights to the movie, has been so pleased with its performance so far - nearly $7 million in box office on only 140 screens - that they are going to release it to a much larger number of screens and give it a publicity push.  Obviously this means that this gem will be granted a much larger audience.  Hopefully it will garner the kind of acclaim it deserves.

This low budget ($200,000) film has won uniformly rave reviews, not to mention the 2007 audience award at the Sundance Film Festival. The plot is about as simple as plot can get. An aspiring street musician whose girlfriend left him for London lives above his father's vacuum cleaner repair shop. A younger girl who has moved to Dublin from the Czech Republic after her husband left her hears him play and becomes his motivating inspiration. Their tender friendship is mediated by their mutual love for music, and many people have referred to this film as a musical, what with a dozen or so songs that move the story along. Best of all is a surprise and decidedly ambiguous ending. Actors Glen Hansard of the Dublin-based group The Frames and the Czech singer-songwriter Marketa Irglova (age 17) sing their own songs in this feel-good flick.

"Once" is a real find. The story of a street musician who meets a Czech migr on the streets of downtown Dublin, is a believable, well-made film about love, dreams and making things happen.

Guy (Glen Hansard, a real musician who also appeared in the film "The Commitments"), a street busker who sings his heart out on the streets of Dublin, works in his dad's vacuum repair shop. One day, a young lady (Marketa Irglova), a Czech immigrant, begins to ask him questions about his music, his passions, the inspiration for his ballads. They form a friendship and she encourages him to follow his dream and put together a demo album. As the friendship grows, she helps him negotiate a recording studio and practice the songs. In the process, she invites him into her home, to meet her mother and young daughter. During the course of their relationship, they grow closer, but she is still married and can't let anything happen. They round up some other musicians and begin to work on the demo, to help him with his dream.

"Once", written and directed by John Carney, is a very intimate look at the relationship between these two people. A lot of handheld camera work, close shots and grungy, real locations help to give the film an incredible cinema verite look and style. The camera work is handheld, but not overly shaky, creating shots with an intimate, close appearance, really thrusting us into the middle of the action.

The relationship between Guy and Girl (as they are listed in the credits) is really an interesting one that draws you into their lives. Initially, the guy is a bit put off by the girl, she is extremely chatty and forthcoming, asking him a lot of questions about his music, why he sings certain songs, the inspiration, etc. As a street musician, he is naturally a little weary about people getting too close, he simply wants them to enjoy a little of the music and drop a couple of coins or bills into his guitar case and leave. So, the young woman who stops to ask questions, in her accented English, is a minor annoyance, until he realizes she is genuinely interested.

As their relationship grows, he feels a fondness for her, and as a single man, he naturally flirts with her. But when she realizes this is going too far, she gives him a little look, a minor reprimand, and he realizes she is right. They are friends, sharing an experience. And she is married, even if her husband still lives in the Czech Republic and they are having problems.

As they become friends, they become involved in each other's lives. He meets her mother and daughter, sees where she lives, has dinner at their house. She meets his dad and becomes involved in his making of a demo album.

When the duo shows up at the recording studio, with their fellow street musicians, the sound engineer greets them, but secretly reveals his true feelings to someone on his cell phone. He has a feeling this group is another example of people with too much ambition and not enough talent; they don't even know the technical details of recording the music. But when they start playing, he recognizes they have talent, the songs are good, and the lead singer, our guy, is quite good, so he becomes engrossed in making the demo as good as possible. He becomes a part of their team, investing part of himself in the production of the demo.

Part of the beauty of "Once" is that nothing seems forced. They don't have sex, simply to make the story more dramatic. In fact, the course of their relationship seems all the more real because they simply remain friends, close friends invested in each other's lives and livelihood. There aren't any manufactured crises involving her mother and baby or his dad. They simply struggle with real life.

Also, the music is quite good throughout the film. Guy sings a song, a love ballad he wrote for his girlfriend who moved away to London, a few times, each time making it a little better. Finally, when they record it for the demo, it is as good as it could be, with the girl playing keyboard and singing backup and the addition of the other musicians they have recruited.

"Once" is a film about the guy following his dream. He wants to make a demo and travel to London, to try to get a contract. But perhaps more importantly, he wants to reunite with his girlfriend. All he needs is a little push, a little support and guidance from a friend. He finds that friendship with the girl, his new friend who helps him realize he should go for his dream.

Saw the movie yesterday, when it opened in our local theater.  Decided this morning that I needed to look for the soundtrack.  Have signed up to be notified when the movie becomes available, because it's that good.

I'm not a movie critic, but this one is good enough that I want to encourage other folks to see it.  It's hard to explain the reasoning without giving too much detail about the story, or building it up too much.  But here's what I can say :

During the movie, I recognized that I was waiting for some tragic event (my wife said as we left the theater that she kept waiting for one of them to die), because that's what would happen in a standard Hollywood movie.  How sad that we've grown accustomed to movies that must throw big tragic events at us to create emotional responses because the acting, storywriting, and character development cannot suffice to make us feel emotions on a small scale.

In "Once", the acting and the story (and the music) develop the characters well enough, and tell a story that is plausible enough, that an ordinary tragedy is sufficient to make the viewer feel genuine and complex emotion.  All without trying too hard or backing away from it.  That's brilliant.  Worth seeing more than once, which is why I want to own it.
Splendid, sentamental, charming musical romance with an Irish twist. Set in Dublin without the flashy hollywood glamor or glib quick repartee. Well worth seeing and for "once" not long enough.

I haven't seen "Music & Lyrics," the movie in which Hugh Grant and Drew Barrymore play a songwriting-romantic pair, but John Carney's "Once" probably can be described as a cross between "Music & Lyrics" and "Brief Encounter." This delicate little tale of the musical collaboration and almost-romance between a thirtysomething Dublin street busker (Glen Hansard) and a young Czech immigrant to Ireland (Marketa Irglova) leaves us breathless with its simplicity and beauty. There's a certain amount of stylization--this is the movies, after all--but not the kind we're used to from movie musicals. The beautiful, melancholy songs--nearly all of them by Hansard and/or Irglova--arise organically from the characters, because they are musicians, and the songs they write are how they express themselves. Hansard and Irglova both have lovely, impassioned singing voices, and as actors they have a natural, unforced charisma. (Irglova is a first-time actress, but viewers may remember Hansard as Outspan, guitarist for "The Commitments.") Carney's hand-held cameras give the film a near-documentary feel that nevertheless doesn't skimp on either sentiment or humor. The film's very first scene, depicting Hansard's attempts while busking to keep an obnoxious drunk from stealing his tips, is laugh-out-loud funny while demonstrating the precariousness of Hansard's existence. "Once" is that rare musical that envelops us in music and beauty while bringing home the tough reality of the characters' lives.

Worth every moment of the over ten years to see this movie! Amazing music, and such a tender smoldering love that develops between the characters. Thanks, Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov! Magnificent movie.
One of my favorite movies!
My all time favorite movie, happy to own it now. Came in great condition.
Complex characters presented in a simple dialog and great music.

After reading all of the glowing reviews, I was really looking forward to seeing this movie.  But I was so disappointed!  This movie was so bad that I turned it off after 30 minutes.  I can't think of one good thing to say about it.  I would have tried to put up with the poor picture quality and poor sound if this movie had been at all interesting, but it was boring.  Bad acting, thin plot.  I'm just glad I did not purchase this DVD for "Once".  I bought I because it included three other movies, including "That Thing You Do!"  Now, that is a movie I CAN recommend!
Just hated it. Love Begin Again from same director. Boring, low energy.

I bought this DVD for a friend that saw a stage product/musical version of the film. She told me how much she loved the stage show, and I felt it was completely mandatory that she saw the film. She and her husband eagerly watched this last week, and she was so excited to share how much she now loved the movie! I wholly recommend this movie for passionate music lovers, non-conventional romance-enthusiasts, and anyone with beating heart in their chest (or a deeply black heart that could use some kindling) Once is a short and beautiful piece of content; highly worth the watch and listen.

I saw this movie when it was in the theaters and I loved it. I always love movies that are different and well made. I love the story, the acting, the music. If you love independent films, you won't be dissappointed.
as advertised

This was brilliant and very thoughtfully produced.  I am glad I purchased it for $7 so I can rewatch it.  If you have to have a Disney ending and over produced run of the mill movie this isn't for you!  'Just saying all you indie movie junkies and those that can slow down and appreciate great cinematography and a real life story line you might enjoy this.
Not really my cup of tea.
Glen Hansard is my favorite musician, ever. He is raw talent. This movie dug a hole in my heart and it will stay there forever.
Just fine song writing and after seeing the musical, I wanted the memory of it through this dvd.
One of the best movies ever!
An odd but lovely movie. The music is superb
so much heart, great music, understated story

I haven't much to add to the comments others made . My only regret is not having known about it years ago and missing a chance to see the live production.  If anyone knows how to purchase a DVD of the actual stage play I'd like to see it.
At first I heard the music as different from the normal radio tunes of America , and didn't take to it.
But after a few times through it I'm obsessed with the pure ballad storytelling stripped down music.  I've watched the movie several times & will again & again which I can't say that about others.  Music is the leading role, even more than the people.  I'm so happy to be introduced to something new & different - it opens many doors for me and I know it will for others.
Too slow, but decent movie
Loved it!

So good. So heartfelt. So heartbreaking.

Also, if you ever get a chance to see Glen Hansard in concert don't hesitate for even a second. He's an amazing singer/songwriter and this movie wouldn't be the same without him and his music.
The music is great, but the story is extremely boring...
Thoroughly enjoyed this flick, and the music was perfect.  Such talented characters...
great film...
Fantastic and underrated film!
I Adore this movie and the music too!
Do yourself a favor, watch this movie.  Great for lovers of music.
What a great movie.  Life changer!! The music and everything amazing.
Pulls at your heart strings.  Nicely made...
ok movie
Two thumbs up.
We enjoy this music and the CD very much.
Wonderful, feel -good movie!
Great movie, and wonderful music, the play at the theatre was just as good, but music is better on DVD.
great

While I really loved most of the music in this movie, the language shocked me. Lots of vulgarity and I know in some parts of our world, curse words for me aren't curse words for others, but it was excessive in my opinion. Also, ultimately I get the plot... they needed each other for the music, and in it's own way it's a love story, just not the way you think.
The charming, authentic characters really drew me in and I loved the music. This is a sweet story well worth watching.
Love this movie so much.

This is a sensitive, great movie.
Must see
Good movie. But liked "Begin Again" better, acting & music.

I purchased the movie after seeing the broadway tour.  It may be one of the first movies i have seen after seeing the stage production that i enjoyed just as much.  I can watch the movie as often as i like.  And will see the tour again if it is close by again.  The vocals are great.
Amazing music - it watch it every chance I get and never get tired of it
This is, and will always be one of my favorite films. Glen Hansard is amazing and his songs have so much feeling and soul that you can't help but fall in and feel it too.
DO NOT GET THIS!!!

I took it out of the package and played a "glitchy" version of the movie.  I thought I was purchasing the real movie.  The packaging looked real, but this was obviously a cheap copy.  I want my money back.
ok great songs but a sad ending
Great story, great music, a glimpse of life in Dublin.

We just came off seeing the stage production and really, really loved that and I believe it is one star better than the movie. I have also just come off having discovered The Swell Season, the artists that are the subject of Once. With all that to compare to, I just must say that the stage production seems to me to do a better job of conveying the essence of the story, while the movie seems to be hampered by the hand held camera. The two mediums seem to convey pretty much the same story, maybe some more noted humor in the stage production...but still the same story, just seemingly, to this viewer, done better on stage.
Amazing music and story! A hidden gem of a film!
I've been to  a fair number of shows in the past. This one is stuck in my brain and my heart. Great production. Great performers Love to see it again next time they come around,
good

Lots of F words.
Strange story.

saw Begin Again then gave this a try.

A bittersweet tale

One of my all-time favorites! Absolutely charming & sweet, with an amazing soundtrack.
Saw this play and had to have the movie.  Both are outstanding and emotionally charged.  Love the music, of course.
An incredible movie!!
Love this film!!

This movie is a surprise. Not like anything I have ever seen.  Something about the story and music together just mesh in such a unforgettable way. Once is movie that will stay in your head for a while after watching. Worth watching and owning.
Was good, but not as good as Begin Again.
A tender story from Ireland.  Musical and warm tale of growth and survival.  Not glitzy, just inviting.  Reminds me of some of Edward Burns' movies.

I crave this movie like sushi. It makes me feel comfortable and safe. I sink into what that life would be like. To be surrounded by people who love and play music. I could listen to the song GOLD every day for the rest of my life. I understand the man who wrote it recently passed. A true artist through and through. That song is heaven on earth. Love this movie so happy I have it now.
oscar winner song
Second time watching this. So enjoyable. Better than the theatre performance which I found lacking.
Fantastic score and great performance by the musicians. What a sweet story and a fantastic setting
Sweet film.
Great romantic film
This is such a sweet story with incredible music!
Would have liked to have more Irish scenery

Love this movie. A few slow moments but the (folk) music is really great and the story line is very sweet. It's a go to movie. I sometimes put it on just for background music. Sing along for sure! * Kind of like when I have Phantom of the Opera playing! I have to sing along to that one too!
Not as good as play.
An inspiring look at Dublin's musicians who continue to pursue their art in spite of their humble circumstances.

Again, a musical story so raw it's real to me. As a lifelong musician who likes to play piano and guitar, sing, or even act; I wish I'd written this stuff. This film (and later record setting Tony Award winning play) is gorgeous with each note. Gold. In every way.
This is a delightful film for musicians, and probably non-musicians as well! The music is a treat!

A VERY nice film. I watched it because it came so highly recommended, along with Carney's "Begin Again" (which I liked a lot), and "Sing Street" (which is  one of my favorite movies of all time, and I'm not 30 anymore, or even 50... well, let's not go there..), as well as "The Commitments". I have to say I wasn't as enthused as I expected to be, but that was largely because I didn't really like the songs. The premise is charming, and the characters engaging, including the secondary characters (the father, the shop owner, the mother and the friends who come to watch TV, not to mention the Hoover, who develops quite a personality!)

If you like sorta-musicals you may like this. Certainly many did, judging from reviews. It may have been charmingly odd but I need more of both to stick with.  For me, it was slowed down to a painful pace with music I didn't like.
A more sophisticated pallet (for movies and music) may be needed to appreciate this movie...I gave it a try because of the good reviews. I played it all the way thru but didn't bother pausing during kitchen or w.c. runs and I don't remember how it ended, just that I was glad it did.
So good!

I first saw a part of this film on cable and it piqued my interest so i purchased the dvd,since then i have seen it several times and i must say that i absolutely love this film,considering that most films being made currently feature plenty of cgi or are remakes of films from the past it is refreshing to have a film that focuses on a story and i think that the story in Once is a damn good one...I don't want to give away the movie for those that have not seen it but will say this..If you enjoy films with a story to tell and that also feature good music Once would be a worthy investment of your time.
What a wonderful, escapist movie.
Lovely story enjoyed the music. A bit confused of the plot at times...would def watch again

This movie is absolutely endearing!! For just "Once" in your life, the movie leaves you feeling the need to fall in love all over again or maybe even for the first time. And sometimes finding that one to love is enough even if they can't be yours. The music is captivating...bonus!! A must see! I am sure I will not be just watching this movie only "Once"!!!
Good music, well developed characters
It was better than the musical but painfully slow.  Some of the music was enjoyable.
Beautiful little indie film with a great story line, excellent actors, and exceptional soundtrack. You won't be disappointed with this hauntingly beautiful musical/movie!
The ending left the viewer hanging.
Excellent movie!!
The movie is great. My purchase experience with Amazon was flawless.
A small story but so full of feeling and talent it will touch your heart. The music is amazing; kudos to the actors who wrote and performed their own work.

Really enjoyed this movie. I had never heard of it until a good friend told me. I watched one Sunday morning and lost myself in this beautiful story. Yeah, it's a love story but the characters are really wonderful and quirky. And the music is so satisfying. I would say yes see it.  I didn't give it full 5 stars due to the ending...I would have liked it to end differently but that's just me being selfish. It was really great.
good movie
This was a very touching movie with some really great music. I recommend it for everyone.

We loved this low key story of encouragement & friendship BUT it just sort of faded at the end. I guess some friendships happen like that.
One of my favorite movies. We actually chose "Falling Slowly" for our wedding song. Excellent acting, incredible music and a storyline that holds the two together. Have watched it numerous times.
Sweet film, loved the music. A bit slow-and too melancholy for my personal taste. Acting was great!

Amazing film and outstanding soundtrack. Truly one of my all-time favorite movies and the whole "art-imitates-life-imitates-art" aspect surrounding the principle characters' subsequent romance/musical collaboration adds to the romance.
Ok

It is a very unique movie.  It's like watching two people's lives intersect and move on, but that is all.  There's no horrific adversity to overcome, no bad guy to win the day over, nothing like a typical plot structure.  The 'rising action' is simply "will the next song be as amazing as the previous song???"  yes.  yes it is.
Just okay.

I'd seen the movie, then saw the live show and got the movie for my son.  The live show is much better than the movie.  The actors are good.  The live show has so much more excitement in it due to the live performances on the instruments.  The energy is not conveyed well in the movie.  Still, the songs are well written and performed, but see the live show if it comes around you-you won't regret it.
great music and bittersweet story
Love this movie, just love it <3

Though the camera isn't the steadiest, the story makes up for it.  What you think is a standard story of Guy meets Girl doesn't always go as expected.  Add to that some amazing music, and a great movie is formed.  If you've seen the play, you'll love the movie and vice versa.
Great story with great music.
Amazing  independent film

The minute I saw this movie I was hooked on Glen and Marketa.  The film is much better than the play.....sorry...there's nothing like the original singer/song writers acting and showing their "love story".
Great movie
Such a good movie.  I loved the musicals so it was great to watch the movie.
Sweet, charming, and tender, with beautiful music woven into the story! Unexpected and quirky surprises kept me smiling and enthralled throughout. Very highly recommended!
awesome movie
Great music,

I will watch this movie again for sure!

A touching indi production made on a shoe string with non-actors that somehow works.  The one hitch for me is that I didn't care much for Glen Hansard's voice and guitar playing - recommend watching a YouTube video that includes him singing before buying the DVD.
It needs a sequel.  What happens next?

This movie will strike notes with you you thought you didn't have. It will make you feel love, then take you down the road of loss just as slowly and delicately.

It's a quaint reminder of life's lovely way of making things right, and in the same exact moment, wrong.
Kind of like a home movie.
Brilliant understated film. Just lovely.
This movie is so sweet, and I love the music in it!

After reading the reviews, I purchased the movie because it is set in Dublin, and because the plot sounded unique and the music pleasant.  Maybe it's because I'm an older person, but I found the poor filming to be distracting and most of the music to be repetitive and tiresome.  I think that Markta Irglov's music was beautiful, and I liked the performance of her with Glen Hansard and the band, but Hansard's solo numbers didn't appeal to me at all.  And most of the film was music....not much meat to the plot. I watched it....Once.
This movie is such a surprise.  How did it miss wide distribution in the theaters?  Best soundtrack to a movie in many years, and such a well told story.
amazing story and music
great movie. very sweet.
This is one of my favorite movies ever.  The music is great.  It is a simple movie, but great.
Bought this because I LOVE the movie.  It's a keeper
One of my favorite movies. Love the music.
This is a little gem of a movie. Simple, honest and subtly powerful. You will not forget this film! Highly recommend.
Great product

It's a very quiet and sometimes slow moving movie, but that's what life is sometimes. There's other parts where it's super intense and the music is heart pounding. Their chemistry is great, and I love knowing they ended up dating for a small amount of time.

interesting, but hard to understand the dialogue.  seems like a graduate school project. has some good moments that made me feel it was worth watching.  Not a film for everybody.

Good movie, good music.

More info: This movie, Once, is a 2007 Irish musical film written and directed by John Carney. Set in Dublin, Ireland, the naturalistic drama stars musicians Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov. Hansard and Irglov composed and performed all of the original songs in the film.

I heard "Falling Slowly" for the 1st time when Ellenowen used it to audition on season one of The Voice and loved bith the song and them instantly. After doing some digging I found out who did the original. Long story short I found this film/The Swell Season and fell in love again. Theres no really ground breaking dialoge but the magic these 2 make in the studio is awesome

Absolutely worth the watch!  Now I can't get enough of Glen Hansard's music!

This is a wonderful feel-good movie with beautiful heart-felt music. It's a must-see flick.

Great movie.

The movie that was assigned to our class, Once, is appropriately titled for once is exactly how many times I will watch it in my lifetime.  The movie started off somewhat interesting as the main character gets robbed and chases the thief down, only to catch him and let him walk away as if nothing even happened.  This act summed up the rest of the movie. Due to the main character being a pusillaminous man, the remainder of the movie was incredibly slow.  As the movie played, I became so bored and disinterested with the characters and their need to play 20 minute songs that I began to wonder if Professor Small was mad at the class, and assigned this movie as a form of punishment.  I also thought about the fact that Amazon users rated this movie a 7.9; which to me is obvious that people were so upset that they wasted an hour and twenty seven minutes of their lives they refused to let this movie rob them of any more time and just not rate or review it.

As the songs played in the movie, I couldn't help but think that the main characters voice sounded similar to that of a wailing man attempting and poorly imitating the voice of a woman who had just gotten over strep throat and smoked a pack of cigarettes before singing.  This movie had me bored and thinking about all of the things wrong that Ive done through the years and balancing whether or not I deserved this punishment.  I am proud to conclude I did not deserve this punishment.  They should play this movie on loop at terrorist detention centers and watch the confessions flood in as prisoners beg for this movie to stop.  This film is simply a drama of two emotionally unavailable characters, who are naturally attracted to one another through their mutual interest in music, as they keep reminding themselves of their previous partners in musical form.  I cant believe this film was actually funded.  The majority of the movie seemed to be shot with a handheld video camera, not for artistic value but simply because the producers saved all of the funding to rent the crane used for the final shot.  Which was also the best shot of the movie, not because of the crane, but because the movie was over.  Thank god (or whatever higher power you believe in) that I don't have to watch this film ever again.  If I were to go on a date, and my date made me sit through this, I would never talk to them again, even if there was a spark between us.  It should be noted that my girlfriend willingly watched this movie with me, which should elevate her to sainthood.

In conclusion, I hated this movie and never want to see it, or anything about it ever again.  I cant believe I spent $3 bucks to rent it.  I wouldve rather donated that $3 to a homeless person so that they could get their next meal, but instead of doing a good deed, I had to stain my eyes with the abomination that is known as the movie called Once.

I loved Begin Again and this was recommended as similar. I'm shocked and confused by the great reviews this received. It was so awful, I had to stop watching after 15 minutes. Music and singing were atrocious. No charm, no chemistry, nothing remotely appealing about this at all!! Maybe it got better but highly doubtful. Don't bother. Glad I borrowed and didn't buy.

Once is a film I do not have the heart to downrate because at least the male lead is making an effort. But overall, it comes off as amateur and I am not feeling the vibe of the film. The scenario is like Lost in Translation but there is no chemistry and if there is no chemistry, what does it matter what happens? Still, it is an OK film, short, and not difficult to get through.

I haven't been this moved by a film about music since Almost Famous. I didn't think another film could do that. What both of those films have in common is that the film makers or writers knew the inner life of music in ways that only one who had really been there could. They knew they walked on holy ground and they told the story with all of the heart and poignancy and stunning revelation that that witnessing leaves in the souls of those who traverse the beautiful territory.

In a way, the two co-stars are engaging, and it's fun for this old musician to be taken back to the days when I never went anywhere without my guitar -- but it didn't wear well with my wife and me, and we gave up on it about a third of the way through it.

He was extra miserable the last four or five weeks before he died...  This film was the only time I saw him relax and really enjoy.  He ENJOYED the story and especially the music.  I can't give enough stars or enough words gratitude to say how much I appreciate being able to stream it for him.  And yes, it is a fabulous story with fabulous music.  Simply beautiful.

I had a lady friend with whom I had a similar relationship to that of Guy and Girl. She was also in the music business and we were in the same performing group. A subtle, smart, and sneaky musical. It's filmed in a realistic, almost documentary style. And the songs aren't big numbers like Dreamgirls, Chicago, or Les Mis. The music and lyrics grow out of the context of the relationship between the two main characters, as they introduce themselves slowly to each other. This film is both heart-breaking and affirming, and proves that love stories can have happy endings without everyone living happily ever after.

After seeing the Broadway version of 'Once,' the viewer (i.e., this viewer) can return to the original movie. And begin fully to appreciate it.  In my opinion, it is a minor miracle.  Subtle, sublime and heart-movingly wonderful.  How two people who come together seemingly at random grow quickly to love each other; but how each quietly 'knows' that s/he cannot (at least at that moment) be together....  I wonder what destiny and providence hold for these two simple but glorious folks.  May they both be happy.  And for the time or for the duration, bear their necessary heartaches well.  I've also grown to adore the music.  Which is greatly and, also, ever so sensitively raised to a new level in the stage version.  It took me a while to realize this too.  But when it hit me, it made a big and lasting effect.

So glad to have this story back in my life. If it weren't for my husband, I wouldn't have known this story existed. If you haven't seen "Once", please take the time to enjoy this love story....this music story.......this life story.
Great Movie.  The music is amazing.
This one didn't do anything for me. Had trouble following where it was going and what the point was.
As advertised.
It was ok, but no where as good as the musical
It was very good.
Great movie!

Great movie! Simple story but well acted.
Great music with soul and passion.
Recently saw the musical but it wasn't as great as the movie.
L
This movie sounds beautiful and tells an honest story about love and family. I watched it on Netflix and immediately had to buy it. So glad I did!
Such an unexpected little treasure of a film.
Love this movie

I ordered this DVD due to some of the posted reviews and because I have relatives in Ireland and have visited Dublin in the past.  I was not sure if I would actually like it but it turned out to be a keeper.  It is a quiet little movie and builds slowly to a nice ending. Stay with it, you will like it. Glen Hansard has an interesting voice and one of the songs in the middle of the movie is sweet and heartfelt (he apparently wrote many of the songs for the movie).
Great movie, AMAZING music
Wonderful movie! Excellent soundtrack.
Nice story, but the repetition of that one song got brutal. Begin Again was much much better.
Terrific movie and service!
Great movie
LUV this movie!
Really well done movie.

My girl liked the movie. She takes these ratings very seriously.

In my opinion, it was a good movie, but I got annoyed that the gimmick of this musical movie video was him reaching really high notes. I know, did I miss the point of this lovely story? nope. That's what earned a quality rating! I had to explain the ending and the title easily 5 times for the next day... Anyway... good flick if your chick likes movies with guys who are a bit dweeby and need a push out of the nest.
Love this movie!
Excellent movie with great music and scenes from Ireland.  A movie that almost wasn't made!
wonderful  charming film
The movie was too slow. There was a lot of singing. Felt almost like a musical. For those who like musicals might be ok. Found it too boring and didn't finish
Loved it
Saw the play in London first and loved the Irish fiddle music which was missing in the movie. Great story though
The live musical is 100 times better, but the movie is good too.

Really meaningful message about being true to yourself and honorable in relationship with others...plus wonderful music and very authentic acting.  Very gladi took the time to watch this inspiring, if improbable story..
One of my favorite movies! Love the music, the actors, everything about it.
Saw the play so we wanted to see the movie. Really loved it and I loved the music so I bought the sound track
Good deal

A different kind of love story. Fresh. Real. The camerawork is raw, and sometimes a bit shaky unlike major studio productions. But, you get into the characters and the music and that kind of just goes away. Music was superb!. You begin to memorize the songs and sing along. I want to buy the CD!
Best movie I've seen in a long time, refreshing, real, and timeless.
slice of life, lots of music, quite upbeat and positive. i enjoyed it.
A very "sweet" movie, without being sloppy about it.  The music is terrific; easy to see how this was made into a Tony-winning Broadway musical.

I loved the music before I saw the film.  I was not disappointed.  The two main characters shared a bittersweet love of music.  The way the story ended gave the viewer a surprise, but a good one. The music performances in the film were spot on perfect.
Very fast service. It was a joy to watch...
A wonderful moving movie with exceptional casting and music filling your heart.

I've always been a fan of stories that follow a musician's dream of reaching an audience. This is also a love story of two friends who have only an outlet in musical expression. As they grow to admire one another and create truly haunting and exciting modern Irish folk music they run into a few obstacles which they overcome with grace and great generosity of spirit. FIlmed on two handy cams with a small independent budget this is a miraculously inventive and worthy piece of art you would be remiss to not see!

Watching "Once" I was reminded of "The Commitments" (no surprise, Hansard played in it) - which I liked better because it was more complex in its plot, and of "Inside Llewyn Davis" which disappoints a bit when compared to "Once". The music in "Once" is great, the actors convincing and the plot bittersweet but certainly believable. A happy end would have been wrong! Enjoy the film - it will make you feel good!

Spoiler alert: I saw the play and was really hoping for a different ending but the movie stayed true to the story. This is a play/film about a platonic relationship. The heat between the two friends is obvious and yet...they move in different directions, seeking different futures. Real people in a real situation, the music is great too and you really do hope they both have happiness in the choice they made.
Please do not require all the words for people to type.  It is way too time consuming and I will not rate anymore purchases if I have to do this
Have watched this several times. Love the music, the story; everything! I was drawn into the story from the beginning.
Great flick but very hard sometimes to understand their Irish brough and czech accents!  Wonderful music and story line..  I would recomend it to my friends
A gorgeous film.  A sweet and gentle portrayal of the way artists get things done.  Lovely and so highly recommended.

This is one of my favorite musicals of all time. One because it has a story, and two, because instead of hiring actors to pretend like they play music, they used actual talented musicians...who did a decent job acting. If you have a pulse, you'll love this movie.

I could listen to this soundtrack forever and never tire of it.  I get really bored watching movies over and over but this one always makes me cry at the exact location even though I know the ending.  It is so not Hollywood and that is what makes it wonderful.  The music is cerebral and contains the 2008 Academy Award winning song Falling Slowly.  In the movie it was a climax on a piano/guitar with the eb and flow of the interaction.  Didn't need any nudity because it was better than physical lovemaking.

I just saw this film for the second time since its release 7 years ago. Its naturalistic approach to love and life, letting the music develop and sustain the plot line rather than the events or even the dialogue,
provides us with an extraordinary film experience. The first duet that the new friends play has haunted me for years but I was unable to understand the words.  This time I opened "closed captions" on my screen menu and the exquisite lyrics were there for me, not disrupting the bonding that rapidly develops between  the young people as they play.  Money is not readily available to me at this moment but I immediately ordered "Once" and hope to share it with a wide variety of family and friends.  This film remains a sleeper.  For me, it is a classic!
We viewed this as an overview of the story.  We are seeing the play in New York.  Both charming and depressing, but a nice movie.

A perfect love story with an unpredictable ending and magnificent music.  It is easy to see how the little indie picture managed to survive for several years, often buried in the dark, only to shoot forward to win the Oscar for best score.  I highly recommend it.  Watch it with a loved one.  Note:  The first minute and a half or so are in thick Gallic, and a little hard to understand.  Hang in there, it clears up right away..
no wonder they made a broadway musical out of it - proof you can make a great movie on a low budget.
Music and acting were great.  We just saw the musical also and  we thought the movie was just as good.
This is a wonderful movie.  Made in 30 days, the story, music and actors all work to make this lovely movie unforgettable.
A very different type of musical. It will touch your heart. I saw it a few years ago at the Maui Film Festival and it was a treat to see it again. Great music too.
Bought this after watching it one night with my husband.  Loved the music so much and the realistic interpretation of whta happens in life! Seller sent it quickly and in great condition!

A steal for a great movie. They made this into a broadway musical, so that says something about the story telling. The music is great. I can't tell if it's fictional or semi-biographical. Seems like a true story. Our whole family enjoyed this - ages 15-60.

A friend of mine stopped watching the movie because he had trouble with the accents. Well, you might not be able to pick up every word, but your heart will understand. This is such a beautiful movie about creativity, longing, and love. The scene in the music shop where she starts playing the piano is a mini-movie in itself. Overall, well-deserving of all the praise the other reviewers have heaped upon it.
I saw the Broadway play and just had to see the independent film it was based on.  That was a great call!

I bought this because the characters are Irish (who doesn't love a good Irish love story?!).  But the movie was pretty boring and repetitive.  The main female actress was a bit bland and there wasn't much chemistry between her and the male lead.  Too much music and not enough substance.
You will enjoy the ballads as you watch the two singer songwriters meet, become friends, and talk about their lives.
Love, love, love this movie - so happy to have found it! Thank you! Will definitely shop here again for future purchases.
If you like lots of singing and very little story line or dialog, then you'll love it. Otherwise, it's barely ok.
I can't explain how much I love this movie! Always loved musicals but this is the cat's meow! Watch it!!!!

Small movie, made with two handheld cameras, in 17 days for 100,000 euros. You can believe the characters and their interaction.  a couple of scenes stayed in mind for a long time,  Though it was a satisfying movie in and of itself I wish there were a part two so I could see what happened next.  That's how much I cared about the characters.

If you have trouble picking up the dialog turn on the subtitles.
Once is one of the most creative and beautiful depictions I've seen of authentic relationships. And the music is amazing!
This was one of the best films I've watched in the past decade.  A great story with great music.  A must watch movie.

I think this came first, but the play was way better. I really got irritated that there was none of the comedy that's been added into the play. I suspect this was a low budget film. The story differs just enough to really irk me at points such as not giving the supporting cast a greater story. I still enjoyed it, but not nearly as much as I enjoyed the play. Perhaps if they decide to do a sequel that will be fixed. If you're trying to decide between seeing the movie or the play first, I would suggest watch the movie first. You'll have a greater understanding of some of the things during the play and you'll be pleasantly surprised with the script improvements.

The music and the performer were OUTSTANDING! The story line was lacking imagination. Wish there were few more twists and turns to make the observer excited and drawn to this movie.

That song that he sang at night on a street truly got through our skins - goose bumps!!! The song was REALLY moving and touching!
Can barely understand the dialect.  Very boring.  Music not moving.  Had trouble caring.  Saw musical on stage.  Hated it.  Wanted to like it.  Thought movie might be better.  Not.
I have seen it twice and decided to buy one for my 17 year old granddaughter, who enjoys playing the piano..
This is a beautiful, sweet story of love and music.  Not a typical love story, and the music is extraordinary!
One of the best indie movies ever!  What a find!  Love the way their voices compliment each other and the story, heartwarming
the music is lovely, the acting good,the story is a bit slow in starting, I could not finish the video as the quality was poor
Since I am going to see the play this week I got a heads-up listening to the music. I enjoyed the plot and the music.
Excellent movie.  I am a professional musician and I found this to be so very touching and realistic.  This film gets the feels, but without glorifying the life of a musician.

What a wonderful movie, and when my husband told me how the play ended, I thought, oh, what a shame. But after seeing the movie, I reflected on how it's refreshing to have a movie where two people are kindred spirits, but it doesn't lead to a one night stand or a short-lived infatuation. They help to heal each others hearts, make a great record, then life moves on. It's a beautiful movie, with FANTASTIC music.
This was a great music in a two ways.  It has beautiful music and lyrics, and a great honest onscreen romance by those who actually wrote the songs.

I loved, loved the music--the humor and the drama. The actors were wonderful, and the story, so poignant.
Only complaint:  I could have done without so many used of the "F" word...seriously!
It was one of those "nice story" movies... But rather slow and could have been edited better... Not very much substance.
A romantic and profound story with very beautiful songs.  Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov made a excelent performance, as actors and musicians.

After seeing the Broadplay in NYC, we wanted to see the movie.  Found it complemented the play beutifully.  Loved that the movie was cast with the actual Irish songwriter.  Beautiful story, music and cinematography.

I saw the broadway musical and loved it so much that I had to buy the movie. The background noise can be a little over-powering in spots but just a beautiful story with great music. Spoiler alert! I liked the ending of the musical better because there is a chance that the couple stays together.
Rewatched this for the third time. Sweet story. Feels like a documentary. Lovely music. This movie is close to perfec for me.
A very nice and comfortable story.  Well told.  You'll feel good after seeing this movie hearing the wonderful music of Glen Hansard.  Terrific music.
I enjoyed this movie.  The ending just kinda trailed off though ... will there be a sequel?  There were a number of things that weren't resolved.
I don't see what people liked about this movie. Why all the melodrama over how great it is? I was bored the entire way through.
The songs in this film are hypnotic!  SImple story but there is so much too it.  Also bought the sound track.
Loved this movie. Sweet story. Decent acting and good music. I enjoyed watching it. What more is there to say?

i saw this on broadway and LOVED it soooo much that i raced home to purchase the dvd.  [i think they sell this in the theater kiosk but it is almost $30/dvd.]  although the dvd is much cheaper on-line, i found that it lacks the "charm" and experience compared to the broadway production.  then again, if you can't see it on broadway, this might be the next-best-thing.  apparently, my brother-in-law saw the movie and enjoyed it...not having seen the theater production.
A friend told me and this movie very sad movie going to give it to him he enjoy this movie
It was more like a couple of scenes, greatly extended to the length of a film. I did enjoy the music.
Absolutely love this movie! Recommended by a friend. The music is captivating. It brought me to tears. Had to buy the soundtrack.

Great music and great story about 2 people living in the same world with completely separate backgrounds and expectations/motivations in life who happen to meet and develope a deep regard for one another through music (not entirely sure it was ever love even though they got married because they also got divorced.)

I never get tired of this movie, not just of the script but also of the success story in the background of the artists who made the film without having the external resources of the world in their pockets.
this was a beautiful film, Sweet story, Amazing music, watched it twice, would rent it again, might even buy it.

I couldn't give the movie a five after seeing the Broadway show which has so much more music and is just so much livelier.
It is a good story, but being American, I had problems at time understanding the dialects in the movie.
Still, you loved the Broadway musical, you will enjoy this video.  Sweet story.  Great musical talent.
We lost our recording but enjoy the story, the history behind it's making and the music so we wanted to keep watching it.

I was captivated by the actors and the naturalness of their portrayals. I loved the music and especially the recording session. I saw this first by chance, but am delighted to know I can watch it anytime now. One of my all time favorites and I was going to movies in the 40's.

I received the DVD in brand new condition, which was great.  There area a lot of really great special features, including interviews with the cast and crew, which make worth owning.
The film itself easily makes my top ten.  Normally I don't like musicals, but the numbers are done in a way that is fully integrated into the film.  Usually I'm left wondering why characters in Disney films are suddenly breaking into song.
Where this film really succeed is in its story, which is very basic love story, but done in such an eloquent way I can't help loving it.  I think they also manage to avoid a lot of the love story clichs.  This film is about two people who bond through their music.
My one criticism is although all the characters are speaking English, it's hard to understand some of the thick accents sometimes.  I had to turn on the subtitles the first time I watched it.  But that didn't hinder my enjoyment of the film at all.
So, I highly recommend this film.  It's about people being in love, and I think everyone can relate to that.

I love the duet of voices.  They both compliment each other.  The story is original in part and the voices are awesome.  I loved this film because of love the piano and acoustics from the guitar.  Beautiful!
Every now and then a movie comes along with a simple story-line and it knocks you off your feet.  This is one of them.
Chick flik I was ready to hate, wife watched it once, I've seen it 3 times and ordered a copy, enough said.

Lower budget movie with a lots of hand held camera work. But the music was great.
Great songs sung by the original  artist, which are also the actors in this movie.
A lovely romantic moview that is sweet and touched my heart.  But then I'm always a sucker for a handsome Irish poet!

Love the music score but, the movie is a bit bizarre how these 2 people meet and form a relationship. I don't want to say to much but, I do recommend the movie even though the broadway play is different than the movie you won't be disappointed with the movie.

I hunted for this indie movie because the traveling Broadway musical based on "Once" was coming to town, with quite a bit of advance excitement.  I found the movie low key but lovely - also discovered I had to use the closed captioning to discern all of the dialog in the Irish/Czech accents.  Impressed by the quality of the music, which is the heart and soul of the movie.

I wouldn't mind the low-budget production values, if the script and story line had been worth the effort pf making of the movie..... They should have just made a couple of music videos of the best songs, and called it a day.....

Once is the story of a simple, uncomplicated relationship.  The lead actor and actress are superb -- No one could play the parts better.  The music score is wonderfully earthy.

You will leave the theatre humming the music, especially "Falling Slowly" !
Sweet story line. Wanted to see it before we go and see the play that is coming to our city in May
Lovely story.  Beautiful music.  Just saw the play and there are a few differences but overall it was worth watching.
The music is simply beautiful, the story is powerful and so intimate that each of us can be seen in it.
Enjoyed the movie and music a great deal. Suggest it with a glass of red wine and fire in the fireplace.
I was touched deeply by the songs and voices.  A simple friendship story without all the Hollywood bs. A bitter sweet ending

The music is awesome. I keep hearing it my head long after I watched it. This is a touching story of how music inspires all of us. I was surprised to see the actors are also the song writers. They are equally talented in both.

I bought this after seeing the play on Broadway in Feb 2014.  Not sure which I liked better.  My 18 year old daughter loved the play because it left you with the hope that the couple would be together in the end.  SPOILER ALERT** The movie has them parting ways, and in the spirit of romantic, boy-and-girl-are-together-in-the-end-movies, this doesn't do it.
 The soundtrack is infectious and I've had it in my car for over a month.  Just when I think I can't listen to it anymore, I put it on again and I can still feel the spirit of the actors in the play and movie.  That's powerful!

A Dublin street musician meets a pretty Czech musician seeking a Hoover vacuum repair. In addition to the vacuum repair he can provide, she and the Irish lad connect and create music at a recording studio, surprising themselves and everyone involved in the effort. The story - as you can see - is quirky and charming. Music is great, too.  We've been tempted to see it more than once.
Warm hearted subject matter.  Depicts the development of a relationship through musical collaboration. The ending forces you to use your imagination.
This Irish tale sneaks up on you and charms you throughout the movie. The acting is believable, and the music is wonderful. It starts great and ends better.
This Rom-Com-ish movie has terrific music and very few cliches.  I'll leave it at that.  Very different, very good.  The Irish accents can be difficult to understand for Yanks.
Once was a delightful blend of Irish music, dance, and a  portrayal of a love story. I saw it as a preview to the Broadway production and was happy for the background.

I've seen the Broadway play of Once and a touring production and really liked them. The movie preceded the play. It's similar, of course, but also has several differences. The song writer is also the star of this movie (he was also in The Commitments). This story (both the movie and the play) is quite touching. Thumbs up for sure.

While the movie is pretty good, the musical based upon the movie is fantastic!  It seems the musical benefited from greater love and care than did the movie. If you're going to see the musical, I highly recommend seeing the film first so you have a point of reference.  WONDERFUL music, to be sure!
This was highly recommended by my friends. I found it very dull & boring. I'm sorry I wasted my time watching it. Very little plot, mediocore music.
Not your usual love story but it was amazing ! Definitely a must watch for anyone who likes an interesting story

Far better than what I expected. Heard mention of poor quality in filming, but I viewed it on a very large screen and thought it was excellent.
Absolutely loved it!

I enjoyed this movie about an Irish couple and band trying to make it big. The story line is realistic with good writing and
acting but the music is repetitive to my ears and eventually boring.
Was not like what I saw on T.V.  It was very confusing to me on what to order.  Guess my mistake....
Raw, beautiful music. I saw the musical and decided to watch the movie. I was thoroughly satisfied with them both!
A very nicely developed love story but a disappointing ending. Enjoyed those 2 great characters and loved the simple plot. Music stays with u .
Saw the play in New York and wanted to compare it to the movie that it was based upon. Each was wonderful in its own way. The movie is a simpler telling of the story but as moving as the play!!
Moderately entertaining movie, but it was very slow and I'm still not sure what the point was.  I wanted a bit more of Ireland, but this could have been set anywhere.
This is a wonderful movie and I sent it to my sister and her family has enjoyed it as well.

Everything, from the characters to the soundtrack, was great. There was no excessive, unwarranted drama. No excessive, unwarranted romance. The characters were believable and lovable, and I walked away from the film with a smile on my face. I was entertained.
This is what cinema should be! Genuine story, authentic acting, and is relatable. There is no hype, just a good realistic story, with a realistic ending.
My friends wanted me to watch this for a while and I finally got around to it. Couldn't be more impressed <3

A friend recommended this movie knowing I'm fond of Dublin. The whiny, dopey singing was the only thing worse than the whiny, dopey plot. I think it was a plot. One good thing was the quick view of the 1800s Poolbeg Lighthouse at the end of the longest sea wall in the UK.

Great music, and stars the original songwriter duo who created the music. They were actual musicians and relative unknowns in the acting world, but they do such a good job in this charming small movie.  It depicts the pathway of a pair of artists in getting their music heard,  and the challenges of their growing affection for each other. I had seen it on PBS but a lot of the language was bleeped out, and it was really hard to watch with all the resulting glitches. Somehow it didn't bother me when I watched this dvd and the cursing was rendered in a heavy Irish accent.
Great movie and love the sound track.  I have given this as a gift so more friends can enjoy it.

Very rarely does a movie come along and tug and every emotion you have. This one does just that. Aside from the beautiful music and on screen chemistry in this simple indie film, the storyline is exceptional and the acting is superb. I believe it to be one of the greatest movies of our generation.

I loved everything about this movie: incredible acting, the simplicity, the hauntingly beautiful soundtrack. What realistic performances by the actors and a great script! I was so in love with Once that I watched the movie twice within several hours.

it did not impress me as I thought it would.

Saw the Broadway show.  Overpriced and jsut as much a downer.

I would not waste my time on this.  Wish I could get those two hours back.

The movie is wonderful but a little disjointed.  The music is amazing.  It is a great film for date night.  The Broadway Musical which won 8 Tony Awards tells this story more clearly with the same incredible music.

I chose this movie as the Broadway Show Once is coming to our city, on tour so I wanted to see the movie ahead of time.  The Broadway show won several Tony's in 2012. The story is a simple one of two individuals who put their musical talents together and come up with a great finished product.  I enjoyed the movie very much now I am ready for the Broadway show when it comes to my city.

This movie was recommended by a friend & I really enjoyed it.  Loved the story line & the music was wonderful.  Just a good story without violence,  nudity or swearing (just a little swearing) Something a little different.

Great & very unique movie!! Inspiring and quite honest. I loved it! It is a film that is very different from modern romantic films as it displays authentic keenness between a man and a woman without the attachment of intimate pleasures. Well done!
Film is shaky and the actors are sometimes hard to hear, but the music is amazing! I saw the musical first, this was a great follow-up.
Loved the storyline and the music. Kept me watching from beginning to end. Characters were very believable. Simply put it was wonderful.
I saw the musical and wanted to see the movie.  I really liked it and loved the music.  I would recommend it.

I didn't see the movie when it came out but heard about it, as the song "Falling Slowly" got an Oscar and then the adapted play got Tony for Best New Musical.  I went to see the play on Broadway and fell completely in love with the music and the story.  I came home and ordered this movie and it didn't disappoint.  It was shot on a super low budget but captured the spirit of the story so well.  The actors are darling, the music is GREAT and the story is wonderful.  Highly recommend it to anyone who loves music, loves anything Irish and who loves a good love story.  This is not your typical Chick Flick - it's good for everyone.  It's only rated R because the "F bomb" is dropped a million times but who cares when it's in an Irish brogue!
Nice "little" movie that says a lot about friendship.  Would have liked more scenes of Dublin.  I am not very musical and that was main focus of movie.

I couldn't play the dvd in any dvd player or laptop. Apparently the dvd only runs in the USA, and not in Europe. When i purchased it, i didn't find a warning or any description that it doesn't work in Europe. Very regrettable!
The story is wonderful and the songs on this movie are even better. Makes me want to see it live on Broadway.

I heard this movie reviewed on NPR.  The woman being interviewed said that it was one of those movies that you can watch over and over.  I tried to get into it and just couldn't.  I lent it to a friend, who said the same thing.  Neither of us watched the whole thing, so hopefully it had a better ending.
Amazing movie!! My girlfriend and I loved it! It wasn't what we were expecting but still a grade A movie!
music is great and stars are original and movie has an original feel thats missing from a lot of hollywood musicals
A good portrayal of two talented people helping and caring for each other without all the other stuff that gets in the way.
I heard the music at the Academy Awards when it won an award some tine ago, I just saw the musical on Broadway, beautiful music, it was a very good movie.

I've watched this movie more than "once." Sorry couldn't resist.
Each time I fall more madly and madly in love with this movie.
Music is incredible, acting is sincere, and scenes are heart wrenching at times.
Seeing the broadway show in the next few weeks and have heard nothing but amazing things.
I can't wait.
I'm hoping no sequel arises from this since it is perfect in it's own right.
Wonderful movie.
Plain and boring story line, if it were not for the music which is pretty nice, I would've given it one star.
We are going to the musical and wanted to see the movie before we see it live.  It was Ok.  Liked the music.  Wish it had a better ending.

The amount of praise surrounding this film baffles me. I almost feel bad giving this rating myself but the truth is, the film is just a poor attempt of a musician trying to break into the limelight. With the intention of being a charming, offbeat, tear jerking romance, it translates to a cheesy and boring waste of time. Poor acting eliminates all connection between the characters, poor writing makes the songs almost hard to listen to, and poor production makes it even hard to watch. Seriously, if you have no budget to work with, at least make your film's plot fresh or interesting. The story has been done many times and this is simply one of the worst of them. The movie came highly recommended from my ex girlfriend. After watching it through, I didn't have the heart to tell her how much I disliked it. Maybe every positive review out there is the result of that same guilt...
The only way I would recommend Once to anyone is if I desperately wanted them to stop asking me for movie recommendations...or if I hated them as much as I do the film.

The Irish have a knack for these stories. Pay attention, it's really good.

This movie is top top. The Irish are really good at showing life in all it's factors.
Incredible movie when one's heart is open. The music is amazing. It is refreshing to watch a romantic movie that your kids can watch also.
Love it! Overall, the product was what I was looking for.  Thank you very much, again, for the this product.
Well done and almost surreal. You don't have to be a romantic either. The music alone is worthy of attention.
My husband is still laughing at this choice for what movie we would watch.  The music was fun, but the story just ended, fairly uncertain of what happened.
What a great movie - had wanted to watch before seeing the show............would highly recommend, and the music so fabulous.

This is an interesting romance that has a slow start in an unusual situation.  The personality of the girl is so cute and she's intelligent and talented as well, and helps the guy to move toward his dreams.
Would recommend this movie to teens & adults. It's pretty cleancut and the music is so great, they've made a musical stageplay out of it, which I really enjoyed this fall. I have gifted this movie to 2 of my granchildren this Xmas, and I'm sure that they & their families will enjoy it.
Cannot get the music out of our heads. Went to Youtube and listened to the Grammy acceptance speech and learned a lot about the film and the artists. Fabulous film.
Watched the first twenty or thirty minutes, found it boring and turned it off. A waste of money to say the least.
Sensitive, real, great music, touching, funny...a wonderful film.  Set in real places and utilizing real people. I was never bored.
This is one of my favorite films. Wonderful story and great music!!! It is a must see for everyone; you won't come away disappointed!
I quite enjoyed this movie.  The story is straight-forward, and the characters are endearing.  I would recommend this to a friend.  Love the piano/guitar duet scene the best!
This movie was incredibly entertaining.  The musical talent was amazing.  One of the best movies I've seen in quite some time.
After seeing the live show, my wife really wanted to see the movie.  It is pretty good.  Not the best movie in terms of moviemaking, but it is still a decent musical.

This is a great independent, musical film about hope. The sort of 'romance' is a secondary part of the film that adds to its likability. Actors and storyline are uplifting, and songs are truly great - make sure to look up the YouTube video of these two at the oscars ...
Loved the story, the singing, the acting, and the location in Dublin. I saw it on Broadway in NYC and that was also excellent
This is a delightful movie filled with humor, warmth and great music. A movie that can be watched over and over.

The music is great. Love the music, and the story flows well. The ending is unexpected too!
Also, I like the atmosphere of this story
This movie is just wonderful.  Very heart warming.  I would recommend it to anyone.  One of my favorites.  It appeals to a wide age range.

Unable to get in the sold out broadway shows and found the movie version to be surprisingly satisfying.  This is what a low budget independent film should be.  Simple story, raw but talented cast in a relatable rendition that warms your heart.

It is a delightful movie.  The music is lovely, and the story is heartwarming.
I have both the movie CD as well as the play CD
We saw the play which is one if iur favorites and were pleasantly surprised with the sweet light touch the movie has. Songs are so memorable and powerful.
This movie was absolutely adorable - very organic and felt like it truly could have just been a camera following around 2 unsuspecting people.

This movie has great music, an unusual story line with a realistic ending, and wonderful stars.  I have watched it several times and will not tire of it.  I also have the album and two others from the same duo.
I watch the preview it look like a good movie. Then I hit the watch  button  . with in the first 30 seconds  the F bomb started flying. So needless to say I turned it off with in the first 3 min
It's ok, but not my kind of movie. My girlfriend wanted to watch it so I watched it with her.
Great music and cute story!!! I really hadn't known what to expect when I ordered the movie, but the music, storyline just take you in!!!

This is an extraordinarily boring movie, and quite amateurish in feel. I watched the entire movie waiting for it to get better, but it was completely blah throughout. I found the fact that neither of the main characters' name was revealed (they are billed in the credits as, "Guy" and "Girl") particularly irritating. That's 85 minute of my life I would like to have back.

I did like the song "Falling Slowly", but that's it.

I think it might work better as a play, but I haven't seen the on-stage version. I certainly cannot recommend the movie.
An over-hyped movie that isn't worth your time and money. The cinematography is like a home movie. I found it boring.

Having been to Ireland this past fall, the movie brought back many memories of the trip. I was disappointed with the ending. I won't say why as people will then know what to expect. Maybe a sequel to tell the rest of the story. Therefore 4 stars vs. 5.

Fantastic movie. Indie films don't really benefit from the visual and sound quality that Blu-Ray offers but this movie needs to be in your library if you enjoy a quality story with a great soundtrack.
Movie dragged, 1-dimensional. Acting was pretty good, but story line was, well, just slow. Thought we would watch this prior to a trip to NY where we thought we might see the play.
I enjoyed the music.  I like the way the story developed and the ending was kind of a surprise to me.
I love love love this movie. It's funny, cheerful, musical, and uplifting. The scene in the piano store is brilliant.

I saw the Musical too...the movie is so much more intimate and meaningful...but I LOVED the musical too.  Please take the time to watch this movie...It is a simple theme that really isn't examined well or often in films...done masterfully.

This is such a good and true movie.  It's s simple and real story.  There's love without sex or violence.
The music is pure and outstanding.
It is a great heartfelt movie with awesome original tunes. I also bought the CD to listen to in me car.

While I loved the music and the depth of the relationship between the two main characters, I was uncomfortable with the usage of the "F" word which didn't help tell the story, and in fact, soiled a wonderful story.  Beyond that uneasiness, it is a beautiful account of two people re-discovering life after brokenness in their own lives through sharing a deep intimacy through music that reached far beyond the expected physical expression.
One of the most beautiful films I've ever had the privilege to watch. A true gem of a story with amazing acting, gorgeous music, and an ending that will make you smile. Don't miss this amazing film.
Great simple masterpiece of a movie with great music...and it was shot for around USD$160,000! Watch it, you'll like it.
It was a small charming movie.  The music and singing was not as good as I had anticipated.  The Dublin setting was enjoyable.

My friend told me about this movie. It is truly very romantic with the reality of that our journey on earth will allow us to meet ones just to share love and magic with them for a while before we separate making that event a very influencing fact in our life. Also I love the music of this film.
The movie is very orignal and fresh.  I did not expect to like this movie as much as I did.  Loved the music too!
This is a simple true story, portrayed by the actual people who lived it and punctuated with their haunting music.
I work a lot and don't have much time to spend watching movies.  Nice to find one that lives up to it's reputation.  One of my new favorites. I absolutely love this movie.
Charming movie.  It won't knock your socks off, but it's fresh and.. charming.  Sort of like a good glass of wine or a hot chocolate (depending on your preference).

I saw this randomly from Netflix and fell in love with it. Can't remember where I bought it but I now have it and  almost all of the music from Glen Hansard, Markita Irglova, Swell Season and The Frames.
A surprisingly beautiful movie - so not your typical film.  Enjoyed it - refreshing and so unHollywood.  No sex, real romance.
Authentic romance about how people bump into each other and inspire each other to do what we know is right.
I found the movie dull, slow moving, uninteresting. The characters seemed very unrealistic to me. I turned it off after 15 minutes or so.

As an independent film, it is really a beautiful film.  Loved the recording session and the relationship of the two main characters.  In the end, it really needed something, can't put my finger on it.  Deserves a kudos for the nontraditional ending.
I enjoyed this movie immensely.  The music was delightful; the story - refreshing.  I am looking forward to seeing it at the Forrest next month.
If you like acoustic guitar this is a must see. I have a old used one I picked up somewhere, but this is a good movie with great music so I sprung for a new one.

This movie was very sweet. I enjoyed the relationship of the guitar player and the girl who he met while playing music on the streets. .She was so very sweet and a talented piano player. He was very passionate about playing his songs he wrote and wanted to make a CD of his music. He became very fond of her. It was because they were enjoying making this CD. They both had past loves and
wrote songs of the relationships that seemed lost. I found that with each of them writing out their feelings in the words of the songs they realized that maybe they should try these past relationships again. They chose to go their separate ways instead of trying a new relationship together.
Once was an excellent movie with great music and we saw it on stage recently in London but preferred the film .

This was recommended by a friend (typically not a movie I'd pick and I'd never heard of it). But, I ended up loving it. The music is outstanding, the acting/movie is so raw and real. I'd definitely recommend it.

Wonderful, sweet surprise of a movie. I rented it after accidentally coming across it and reading the review. I loved it so much that I bought it. In fact, I bought several to give as gifts. The actors have great chemistry, and their voices mesh beautifully in this wonderful story.
A nice story about a guy and a girl that decide to record an album.  The recording turns out great, but the couple never do.  I might watch it again.
I loved the moved, but was disappointed with the constant skips in the DVD itself -- especially during the songs in the movie.
Watched the movie years ago. Saw the Broadway show, watched the movie again. The music is haunting. Appreciated the movie version much more after seeing the Broadway production.
It was a simple tale of two people liking each other and respecting each other without giving in to a sexual attraction.

This movie is not available through Redbox and rarely on TV for free.  It is a great movie to own and watch again every once in awhile.  Classic love story.  After watching the movie, make sure you find out what happens to them in real life.
I had seen Once when it first came out.  I just went to see the musical, Once.  So I decided to buy the DVD so that I can watch it over and over again.

Although the camera work is below Hollywood standards, I found the story line to be interesting enough to keep my attention.  There is a lot of music in it which I enjoyed.
