It's more than a music video, but does seem sometimes to be one.  That said, I liked it and found the ending to be a good one.
It seemed like real life, ending happily and sadly, but ending feeling worth it.  No attempt at adding false drama or false successes to real life.  Sound quality kept it from being 5 stars.

If you love music and/or romance, you'll love this.  WARNING: it does not have the "happy ending" so many people seem to require from movies.  Not all stories end with a "happily ever after."  But the ending is honest. And the movie comes across like a documentary, as if someone just happened to film this happening. It's charming and entertaining and compelling.  So much so that they made an incredibly-successful Broadway show out of it.  See the original - it's SO worth it.
Glen Hansard is one of the musical gems of the last couple of generations.  Whether it is the plaintive sounds of loss and yearning or just driving rock and roll, it's something special.
Good movie, relationship is believable, and music was amazing!  Only drawback -- kinda wished they could have remained together, but oh well.
A lovely story - a true "musical" where the songs are an integral part of the storyline.  Also saw the Broadway adaptation -also great.

Did not like the movie at all very
I don't know how to give no star on less
boring I fell asleep after ten minutes too bad I woke up half hour later. Tried to fall back to sleep could not . Would Like to get my money back. Save your money.
We had pretty bad reception but overall we liked the movie.  Amazingly, Amazon knew about the problem and is crediting our account.  Wondering about watching it again...
I thoroughly enjoyed this movie.  The music is wonderful and the acting is very good.  You will be wanting more and wish the movie doesn't end so soon.
This is the second time I have watched "Once"  and it just keeps getting better. Excellent music and awesome story.
This pseudo-musical will likely be enjoyed by most music fans.  My girlfriend loves the duet, while I love the studio song.

The two stars are special and talented, and the story is great, told through both their actions and their amazing lyrics. This is a very unique movie, give it a try if you like high quality, interesting movies.
Wonderful movie and incredible soundtrack.  After the movie was over I listened to the songs over and over again.  Now I can't wait to see the musical.
Dublin is a great city, and everyone that been there before knows that the city is music and music is the city. A nice love-drama story of two musicians take place there.
Probably one of my favorite movies of all time. The plot, the characters, the music, everything about the movie makes it one that many should watch.
Best movie ever! The music is so amazing..I've seen it 5 times. I also saw the play on Broadway..excellent but the movie is much better.
A gift for a friend of mine.  Her favorite movie of all time.  (she uses that word to describe it).  also, she loves the music.
This film had an authentic feel to it -  you fall in love with the characters, the story and the music!
Movie is a great story of people who love and love their music!!!!!  I think that it is a must see!!!!
I love this movie because it's so different from other movies; it's like listening to a great CD and there just so happens to be a story that goes along with it. If you haven't seen it, you need to!
watched it earlier this year at a friend's place and ordered it on amazon the next day for a great price.  have showed it to friends to get them into it as well.  beautiful love story.
Quality of the movie was not that great...the story line was cute...but just didn't love it! It was slow moving and I couldn't get past the poor quality of the movie.

This was a great purchase.  It came in sealed package and in record time.  We had seen the play in NY and loved it and wanted to catch the movie as well.  It was different, but terrific just the same.
This movie is a delight to watch and the music is wonderful.  The background material on the filming of Once is worth getting the DVD to see how it was done with just $100,000.

This sad, but beautiful love story is about a guy and a girl--that's how they're named in the credits--who meet at the wrong time. He's a busker and vacuum repairman, while she sells magazines and cleans houses. He's an Irishman with a lost love who left for England. She has a husband in the Czech Republic. But the two of them have their own personal musical passions, and when those are combined, the result is more beautiful yet. Like watching two desperate ships passing in the night, the viewer hopes these two will find safe harbor together. Review by the author of A Draft of Moonlight

When I watched this, I didn't realize the 2 main protagonists are actually played by professional musicians. No wonder the soundtrack is wonderful! This is one of those few watch-with-a-smile/feel good films.

Touching, great theme, wonderful music.  An odd twist on a love story and loss of love.  Seemed to me that the ending was sad even though it seemed as if both key players got what they wanted -- or did they?

I hate musicals, HATE them.  But this one was awesome.  A total different approach to musicals in a rock way that wasn't creepy wimpy or lame.
Top 5 movies of all time for me.  And I'm more a Rocky I, Happy Gilmore type person.
This is a lovely modern musical with an awesome soundtrack.  The actors portraying the two main characters are not trained in acting, they are professional musicians.  They both do a great job.

I cannot say enough about this simple, poignent film. There are not a lot of Hollywood flair to this film and that's what makes it so good. The "actors" are the real musicians and they deliver a real, emotional performance. I saw the Broadway play after the film and I enjoyed it - the film still holds first place for me but it was nice to see it come to life on stage. If you love good music you will love this film.

I got pulled into the story rather early. Boy meets girl, girl cheats, girl goes to London, boy remains in Ireland, boy mourns. Boy meets another girl, she's married. They make great music together. Boy still misses London girlfriend. I enjoyed the music so much I bought the sound track. Only when I shared a viewing with a friend did I note the abundance of the F bomb. Beyond that disappointment, I, very much, enjoyed the story. Although the lead characters were musicians first and actors second, I saw no deficiency. The lead actor/musician wrote many of the compositions. Happy times mixed with tears. In spite of my faulting it for the language, I DID enjoy this movie - to the point of purchasing it. To help with your overall experience, be sure to watch the bonus features. Maybe, like me, you'll also buy the music. Grab a glass of wine, some cheese and crackers and sit down and watch this one.
Was disappointed in the stage play. Though the movie was better. The music is the best part of the story.
Remembered Glen Hansard from 'The Commitments', but knew nothing about his career.  Fun movie to watch and will certainly watch it again.
This is one of the best and most under-rated Movie that I have seen and is terrific in it's music and acting and writing and directing; it has it all!! A heartfelt top notch film,
Watched this movie after seeing the stage adaptation. It was very good. Mellow slice of life. Great performances. Not as tragic as the stage play.

This movie was very entertaining as a slow paced mayhappenstance love story with an alternative ending you don't see in more movies. It is a melancholy presentation leading your heart to want them to succeed...

The movie has music integrated into it but is far from any musical I have ever seen. It may be a bit slow for some people who have short attention spans and lack the ability to stay with the plot line. If you are uncultured in the way of foreign mild Irish accents you may have a hard time understanding the dialogue in parts. It is a cute Sunday movie I would suggest you watch with your romantic partner.
Wonderful, sweet movie. Great music/soundtrack! Sit back with a cup of tea, relax and watch it, then go buy the music. That's what I did.
This was an interesting movie. The music was great but it was kinda hard to keep track of the plot. I did not like how the ending was.
Killer.  Wonderful. Unique. Aesthetic. You like life and winning you'll love it.  Want  everything to die.  This is not your movie.

I was so surprised and pleased to see that this finally came out on Blu-ray! I have to confess, though, that I was skeptical about whether or not it would actually turn out to be "Region-Free" (see my review of the theoretically all-region BD of "Clone")... especially since the "Product Details" section of Amazon's ad states that it is "Region B/2".

For myself, it wouldn't matter, since (thanks to the "Clone" fiasco) I now have an all-region-modified Oppo BDP-103 player (best BD player on the planet, by the way)... but for the sake of others who need this disc to truly be an all-region one, I'm happy to announce that it is. Incidentally... sharp-eyed consumers will notice that rather than displaying the "A-B-C" region-code symbol on the back of the case, there is no region-code symbol at all. Just to make sure... I switched my Oppo to each of the three individual Blu-ray regions, and this disc played perfectly on each one.

The only caveat I have about the disc is that on the back of the disc's case, it states that the feature's audio output is Dolby Digital 5.1 / DTS Surround / DTS-HD Master Audio... which was an unexpected but very pleasant surprise.

Not true.

The original Standard-Def DVD release of this film was done in 2.1 Dolby Surround... and, not surprisingly, so is this Blu-ray.

Nonetheless... this remains as one of my all-time favorite films, and to have it in beautiful high-definition is absolutely wonderful.

HIGHLY recommended.

Had heard good things, but it was just ok.
Good music, story line was ok.  Just didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would.  Ended somewhat abruptly.

It is great movie...songs and singers fantastic...love story with a twist and not much talking compared to other movies but still characters sing and talk plus joke in Irish or European accent in English (sounds so great).  I love it all.  I even bought the soundtrack to the movie and loved  it on Broadway too (it won the best musical Tony). And just saw lead actor in Once Broadway (TONY BEST ACTOR IN MUSICAL) Steve Kazee when he song original song as singer, songwriter, guitar player and excellent funny talker in show at Studio 54 Below in Manhattan.
Once is one of the more brilliant movies I've seen in a long while. It's a love story without the mushy love and a musical without the cheesy-ness of a musical.
Just a nice sweet movie with good music in it.  Sad in real life this couple did not stay together.  He is doing a broadway show
Mom loves it I love it, and even more, Mom loves it I love it,  secondly, Mom loves it I love it, plus Mom loves it I love it, in addition, Mom loves it I love it, and lastly, Mom loves it I love it.
Loved the movie, and the songs in it. I gave this as a gift. They loved it too.

Beginning to end, I found the two main characters hard to see as a romantic couple - but somehow the music and their interaction make for a story that I could easy watch again. Hopefully I'll get the chance.
Was weird which I liked having watched this from my local library so I decided to buy it came like it should have.

I received this DVD very fast and was tickled to get it since I'm considering tickets to this Broadway show in NYC. The delivery was great and fast however, the movie itself, I thought was pretty boring.... :-)  Of course, that had nothing to do with the seller who was great!

It's got many of the elements I look for.
Believable characters
Uncorrupted plot
Feel good finish
Although I'd have called for more finality or resolve but thats life.
Not my cup of tea. I did like the music in it but that was about it. Hard to watch if you really are not into it.

I enjoyed this movie so much I immediately ordered the soundtrack on CD - from Amazon ofcourse.  When I initially read the movie reviews about this film, I just thought the movie critics were hailing another low budget Indie type of film, but no they were not, this movie was well written, well acted and the music fit the story and the characters.
A non-traditional love story set to heartfelt music.  If you enjoyed the Broadway musical, this is a must-see! 2007 Academy Award winner for Best Original Song, "Falling Slowly".
I absolutely love this movie. It has all that I wanted in it. Every time I watch it I notice something new.
It was a nice story but a little slow for my taste.  Wonderful songs worth a watch just for that.
Product is great, movie was so so.  Came recommended- if you like singing in movies then you will love this.....
Was recommended by a good friend but it couldn't hold our interest. I hear the Broadway production is much better.
This wasn't a movie I would watch again.  I love the song they sing, but the rest of the movie is a chore to watch.
This has got to be one of my favorite movies ever. The music is beautiful and it just tells a great story
I had read rave reviews of this movie and couldn't wait to watch it.  I was a little disappointed with it after all the hype.

"Once" may well be the best music film of our generation.  A chance encounter on a Dublin street between an Irish singer-songwriter and a Czech expat (never sure if she's in the country legally or not) begins a lovely story of friendship based on mutual respect for talent and genuine affection. I checked the DVD out of the local library only to find a damaged spot that completely disrupted the continuity of the story. I was glad to see it uninterrupted. Just as my favorite movie "Besieged" gets at love better than any story I've ever seen, "Once" does the same for friendship. "Once" is a lovely, lovely story. And the music is terrific.
Although I LOVED the musical, the movie is a little slower in pace and didn't leave me feeling as inspired.

The music was excellent but it dominated the movie.  There was not much in the way of dialogue and the male lead seems like more of a musician than an actor. The female lead carried both off well. We had heard raves about the Broadway show but after watching the movie, are not sure why. We expected to see some sort of magical encounter and perhaps the music was that, but the relationship was not. Happy endings for each of them but not together.
The music was great.  The story was real and emotional and the acting was believable. For a low budget movie, it surpassed many big budget, big name productions

Glen Hansard is a powerful singer songwriter presence. But Marketa brings him to life and gives him wings. So the ending disappoints. The director attests they were going for simplicity in the movie and it shows throughout. Other than Hansard's constant moping about his ex, the only real emotion displayed in this film is in the songs. But they are too born in angst and sadness to be inspiring. I wish we could have seen more character development with these two. I never got the impression Marketa was in love enough with her absent husband to welcome him back. Despite Hansard's alluded success, they both seem so alone at the end of it. Sad.
amazing movie - the music is incredible and haunting, the story heartbreaking. i will watch it over and over again.
I saw Once on Broadway so wanted to see the movie.  They are somewhat different, as would be expected, but I loved them both.
This is not my type of movie.  I would say this is for a younger audience and people who enjoy this type of music.
A sweet film and sad love story with really great music.  I can watch it over and over.  Lost it and had to buy a new one.
I liked it I'll watch it again , I've been to Dublin so it brought back memories , and it had a feel good feeling
I highly recommend this film, especially for music lovers. Also recently saw it on Broadway which was great as well.
This is one of the best movies ever made. Glen handsard is amazing. I got it under one week. very great quality!
Heartwarming with a real feel supported by the low budget production values, the music and sincere performances of the leads makes this unlikely movie work so well.
Done on the cheap with unknown actors, this is a great little tale, inspiring and well worth the viewing.  And if you like contemporary Irish rock, you'll love it.
Not really much of a story. Nice movie for killing time I guess, but not a real gripping story. Found myself wondering how much time was left a few times throughout the movie.

It is done in the style of a documentary. If you are looking for your typical romantic comedy, or otherwise, this is not it. I like that about it - nothing glitter or glamor. The acting is wonderful, genuine - you forget that it's not a documentary. It doesn't have the Hollywood ending, which I also like. Has moments of real humor, drama (not melodrama, thank goodness) - sincerity. Wonderful film - if I had anything negative to say, and I really don't, it went on a bit long. But, as to the overall integrity of the film, it was absolutely fine. Enjoyed it very much.

Not only is the music unbelievable in this movie, but the story line is beatiful and envolves all emotions. The movie focuses on relationships and how the power of a relationship can create amazing music and an escape from everyday life. The acting is brillant and the chemistry is perfect.
Adored this movie. Even though I had some trouble with the accents. These two were adorable and the music was wonderful, all set in Ireland. Loved it. Have watched it many times.
My girlfriend and I both lived the movie, and it made a great Christmas present.  Five more words here, yo!

I was first introduced to Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov by my husband in their Swell Season CD. I just love their music and when I learned of this movie they did together, I had to get it.  Highly recommend!  Great story!
Cool movie where music is the main star! The music is beautiful and the storyline is bittersweet! Would def recommend!
If you want to hear some bad singing that seems to go on for ever then this is the movie for you. Who knew that this was going to be a musical about two disfunctional people?

Order this movie now if you have a good taste in cinema!! I heard about Carney's film (Once) from the now-famous play recreation. This film is the epitome of low-budget, d.i.y. masterpieces. It delivers a non-typical story that contains an wonderful journey to an unlikely ending, unlike 90% of the utterly hackneyed movies produced in the mainstream culture of the film industry. To sum it all up, purchase a copy of this DVD or rent the movie if you want to experience a refreshingly exciting filmic adventure.

(No spoilers:) Rotten tomatoes gave this movie a great review and said that it was an uplifting romantic comedy/musical, but I disagree. It's got a lot of songs in it, but it's not anywhere near a Rodgers & Hammerstein musical, and it doesn't feel like Broadway. It feels a lot darker and grittier than the reviews led me to expect.
We enjoyed this movie greatly. It is a great story, low key, but with huge aspirations. The music is great, as you would expect from The Swell Season.

A movie for those who remember -- or would like to remember -- what it was like to be young, when love was confusing, life was a challenge and music really meant something. And for all you old folkies out there. Enjoy! It doesn't get any better than this.
Those who have not seen the movie, need a little nudge and so that is where a great soundtrack discreetly purchased helps out!

After seeing the Broadway production of Once, I wanted to compare it to the movie.  Somehow, I was thinking it might not be as entertaining, but it exceeded my expectations, and it was a treat to see the original main characters, which was why I ordered it anyway.
Great movie! It has music that I really enjoyed. This is the second time that I have watched it. It is a romantic movie.
I saw this many years ago, and recently rented it again. I enjoy the subtleties of this movie in addition to the music. Glen Hansard is an amazingly talented performer.
Once is my very favorite movie and I have watched it many times. The songs and the singing are wonderful

We have someone here from Ireland and she said it was a good movie so I didn't want to give it a poor rating, but I could barely understand anything that was said between the two main characters.  After about thirty minutes we gave up on trying to watch it.
Quality of picture was not always top notch, but that is just a byproduct of the style of the movie and equipment used to shoot it.

I had heard good things about this movie from friends and seen some good reviews. I just finished watching it as a rental, and the only good thing I can say is that I'm glad I didn't spend another $10 to see this in the theatre or buy a DVD. I felt incredibly bored through the entire movie. I also found the songs completely unappealing, and in fact irritating to sit through. There were parts where I couldn't make out the dialogue due to the accents, so that didn't help.  I forced myself to finish watching to see if it got better in the end, since so many people seem to like this movie. It didn't get any better. This was just a complete waste of time and money.

I thought the movie was very sweet, but is was slow moving.  It was such a "slice of life" that I didn't feel like I get the chance to know a whole lot about the characters.  The music was truly beautiful.  All in all, I enjoyed it but wouldn't call it can't miss.

This is one realistic yet  very fanatastic tale
The music is beautiful and the actors so genuine.
Dont this miss this.
What a wonderful independent film with a great original music score.  Glen and Marketa are naturals on the screen, and I would highly recommend this film.
This is one of those low budget independent movies that just works.  The story is great, it's shot in a cool way and the music is just amazing.  Have watched it many times.
This movies is great, it is a great musical story and me and my girlfriend enjoyed the music and production.
This film is not a musical per se, but any music lover will most definitely dig this insightful and dramatic movie.

ONCE is one of those delightful surprises you come across when you are tired of the blitz and glitz of the typical show biz that competes for the position of the shiniest and loudest of the day. This ONCE is a gem that demands so little of us audience because it does not seek for the bright light. Rather it tells a simple story of two people (whose names we never learn in the movie) who just are. The story does not preach, nor does it solicit our sympathy or any such emotion. Yet one cannot help but find a place in the heart that rings true with what ONCE gently presents.

The music is also fantastic.
The characters were interesting and their stories typical of "real" people who get into a "slump" in life.  Their stories were intertwined in a realistic manner.

I saw Glen Hansard recently in concert with Eddie Vedder. It was hard to say who I loved more. I am a new fan of Glen. What great talent and heart goes into his lyrics. This is a sweet little film and the music is simply wonderful. Loved it!
This is one of my favorite movies.  The story is so simple, yet original.  The music is so soulful and is really another character in the film.  A must see.

Love this movie. Cute story line that doesn't have some fake hollywood taint to it. Not one sex scene. Poor hollywood is shaking it head with it's tried and true methods. However, it still portrays, passion for life, struggle, awkward human emotions, survival, and accomplishment. Last, the end doesn't leave life in a pretty bow tied package. There are still struggles going on through the successes. This felt refreshing.

It also feels so honest from a musical perspective because they aren't "real" actors. They are "real" musicians. It makes the movie more authentic. (I always hate watching an actor pretend to play an instrument with bad technique. It becomes so distracting that I can't even hear the music.) The music written for the movie is nice too!

Woo-hoo independent film makers!
The music was really good, but I was disappointed in the ending! :(  There was obvious chemistry between the actors!

Not sure why or how this movie totally sneaked by me upon its original release...I don't even recall hearing the title track until seeing it performed on the Tony Awards. Well THANKS to the Tony's and the stunning live performance, I tracked down the movie and the music and I think I'm changed forever. There's something about "knowing" that other "YOUNG" people on this planet BELIEVE that a man and woman can connect on a level that transcends SEX SCENES and BREAK UP SCENES and truly unite on the most human of levels...in perfect harmony. It just KNOCKED ME OUT! I sobbed with gratitude during the final credits. Its no wonder it became such a successful musical...every scene offers a new song better than the next...utterly unforgettable. Now to find my friends who saw it 5 YEARS AGO and share thoughts...if they can remember! Now one of my top ten of all time, no question.
A few great songs, the rest was fair --  the story line was cliche, really better to just listen to the sound track and skip the rest.
My husband and I both loved this movie, the music is fantastic and the story is hilarious and heartbreaking. Five stars.
Fantastic movie!  Saw the musical in NYC and wanted to see original.  Glad I did, original music and score are fantastic.
A friend referred me to this movie so I watched it. I am so happy I took his advice! The movie inspires such romance and the passion and music touched me to the core in such a profound way.
After seeing the Broadway production, I just had to have this soundtrack!  So great!  The songs are perfection.  If you liked the musical, you must own the soundtrack!

We visit Ireland so I wanted videos that include places in Ireland.  I could't get to the scenery because the acting was so boring and story line so slow.  I turned it off and gave  the movie to my son.

I had seen this movie before and loved it then. So when I saw it was for sale at Amazon I had to have it.  I also followed up with a purchase a few months later of, "The Swell Season" at The Artist's Den with Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova. Just saw that and loved it too.

My wife and I discovered "Once" pretty late, so we saw the Broadway version before we saw the movie (the movie was the original, the stage play is a spin off).  By the time "Once" got to Broadway, it had been refined and shaped into a wonderfully tight and entertaining work.  The movie shares the same plot and characters and music, but it is a much rougher piece of work.  That being said, the film is sweet and often funny and the music is very good.

So this is the movie that spawned the Broadway musical released in March 2012.  Wife and daughter saw the musical in Aug '12 before seeing the movie.  It blew them away with the singing, acting, stage, choreography, script... They couldn't imagine that the movie could live up to that live experience.  While of course not the same, they both loved the movie which rekindled so many warm (and funny) moments.  Is this a blockbuster, mega-million movie? No way and it would lose so much if it were.  Its the flower in a forest that you came upon and simply enjoyed its splendor.  I only saw the movie and was brought into the emotion.  Worth watching quietly.

I learned of this film after hearing about the Broadway show of the same name, which garnered a lot of attention at this year's Tony awards. Reading the various reviews posted here on Amazon is like reliving the iPhone-vs.-Android battle: people seem to be fiercely loyal to the music from either this film or the Broadway cast.  Personally, I think they're both great. The film is romantic and simple. Two people are falling in love, and the music not only seasons the story; it advances it. The songs are deceptively simple but work under your skin, and the entire soundtrack is beautiful and heartfelt. The story is one we've perhaps heard before, but told well. The two stars of the film also wrote and perform the music. The male lead was involved with and gave his blessing to the Broadway show...if he is happy with it, that's good enough for me. I'll likely never get the opportunity to see this show on Broadway, but I'm thrilled to have seen the film, which I'll doubtless watch again and again.

By the way, what a cool feature with Amazon...when I purchased this DVD I got a free 'ticket' to watch the film immediately on Amazon Prime streaming!  I watched the film on my computer the same night I ordered the DVD, so when it came in the mail I already knew how much I loved it.

The video was well packaged, but of poor quality.  At times, the video and sound track did not match, and the general quality of the video was poor.  I am not sure if this was a "bootleg" shot on a hand-held camera in the movie theater, but it was not at all first quality.

I am disappointed with this purchase.
Love this film and the music and the story!  Beautiful!  Takes me to Ireland instantly and reminds me of the beauty of relationships!

Sort of kind of inspiring.  Sort of.  Until you realize that all these two people are doing is churning out a bunch of four-chord songs.

Spirited job on the part of the actors, though.

Yes, we saw the play in New York and was told it was a movie.
So when we got home from NYC I ordered the movie online.
Not as good as the Play but certainly worth it to hear the phenomenal music.

I originally saw this because the red headed guy from The Commitments was in it and I really that film immensely and still do. This was a quieter, more modern view of of two musicians in a more modern Ireland and very enjoyable in a different way. I happen to like the music very much and appreciated that the story didn't follow a Hollywood map with a predictable ending.

I came across the song "Falling Slowly" in a book of sheet music for piano/vocal, and looked up the movie.  Friends had seen it and highly recommended it, so I ordered it.  The DVD arrived promptly and was in excellent condition, at a reasonable price.  The movie was a surprise: the music was wonderful and the story touching.

This purchase was for 5 copies of this movie, making nine so far--one for me and eight for friends and family. When I love a book, I want everyone to read it; I love this movie and I want everyone to see it. It's a low budget indie film set in Dublin; the major characters were not even professional actors.  Yet it's so absorbing and the characters and situations seem so real. (I am not, by the way, an arty indie snob..I love movies, including big budget blockbuster movies.) It touched me as no other movie has in years. And the music! I also fell in love with the music, which now has a prominent place on my Ipod.  Glen Hansard as a songwriter and performer appeals across a lot of age and genre boundaries.  Now i'm going to see the Broadway show, and hope I am not disappointed.
Cute movie.  I've not seen the Play.  Liked the movie, but others watched only parts, and did NOT like it.  To each his/her own.  Glad I purchased.  Will watch again.
I absolutely love this movie! You can really see the emotion and chemistry between the two. Loved the music also! A definite must buy!

I purchased this movie because the Broadway play "Once the Musical" received 8 Tony awards.
I have tickets to see it and wanted some background. Let me say that I have always preferred live musicals as opposed to cinematic musicals.
That said it was just ok for me. Luckily the price was right.
The second CD (american tour) did not play & the movey track skips, the movey DVD was OK.These were new (not used) CDs

Rented this after I heard my son playing and singing music from it.  Rented the Non hd version later so my son could watch.  I enjoyed the story and people, the relationship between two people that although became loving, never crosses the line but actually salvages their chances with their previous loves.  Moving music and plot, think I will buy the album!
If you see this and have like it. Make it a point to see the broadway production of it. Adding words to reach 20!
If you'd like to see how ONCE evolved into today's hit musical, this is the movie for you. Same song's with the original movie cast and since it's a movie there's more of a REAL feel to it too.

If you saw the indie film of the same name, this is a must.  Don't be put off by the critics.  It is sweet story about friendship and love and making music.  The song Falling Slowly won the Oscar in 2007 (?) as a surprise among all the usual Disney generated sugar.

A charming story that starts slowly and gradually gains traction. The stars turn out to be very likeable and ordinary looking which adds to the realism of the story, ie. this is not a Hollywood production with beautiful stars. The music is good and the leads are talented. My wife, who knew something about the movie, talked into renting this on Amazon and we were both happy with the experience. If you're looking for a movie that is off the beaten path I recommend this. The streaming quality was excellent.

I love 'slice of life' movies. If you want a beautifully executed movie heavy on character, light on distracting special effects, Hollywood glam, then this is the movie for you. Simply shot, the characters are complex and hauntingly identifiable. Beautiful movie...
Took me right back to Dublin and the street buskers there.  Fantastic music and a touching story.  Romantic without being mushy.

While visiting my family in Idaho, my daughter-in-law suggested this movie.  She convinced me to stay and watch with the girls because it was very good.  I enjoyed it very much, and after getting home, ordered my own copy from Amazon.  She is planning a movie night with her girlfriends at first opportunity.  I am sure it will go over well.  You can set the dialog to English instead of reading sub-titles.

This was my favorite film from 2007.  I just purchased this Blu ray version.  It is a European product that I will discuss later in the review.  While "Once" is not a traditional musical, about 60% of the film is made up of music.  What makes this movie so special is the way the music is developed.  The Guy and the Girl (that's how the characters are identified) meet in Dublin, Ireland.  The Guy is a native and the Girl is from the Czech Republic.  They are both struggling musicians and begin a friendship that produces some of the best original music from a movie in years (won an Oscar for best song).

Naturally they are attracted to each other but both carry relationship baggage of the recent past.  Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova are rookie actors in the lead roles but are real musicians that became real lovers off-screen.  The Guy and the Girl are obviously meant for each other yet remain committed to others so their relationship doesn't go much beyond great friendship.  But the final scene where the Girl is looking forlornly out her window lets you know she may have just lost more than a musical partner.

When I first saw this film, I was mesmerized by the development of the music.  It was so real it felt almost like a documentary.  Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova are perfect in their roles and show a different side of acting.  Both are terrific musicians and the music is some of the best I've heard in a film.  The songs are poignant and just gorgeous.  Three great scenes to watch for:  1. When the Guy and the Girl finish the standout "Falling Slowly" that the Guy had begun to write.  This is done in a music store.  2.  When the Girl, listening on headphones, sings the words she had written to the Guy's song while walking home from the store where she had purchased batteries for the CD player.  Done in one take!  3.  When the Girl struggles through a very sad song she had written and finally breaks down before she can finish.  Just great direction and great emotion from the actors.  There are many other great scenes in this simple but effective and heartbreakingly beautiful story completed on a miniscule budget.

I had purchased this upgrade to a DVD I owned based on improved video quality as well as an uncompressed audio track.  The Blu ray video is excellent and is definitely better than the original DVD.  The audio is not what was advertised by the seller's (not Amazon) website or even on the Blu ray jacket.  Here is the wording on the jacket label: "Feature audio:  Dolby Digital 5.1/DTS Surround DTS-HD Master Audio."  Here's what you get:  DTS-HD Master Audio 2.0.  There are 2 additional commentary channels both in DTS-HD MA 2.0.  While I admit I was disappointed and clearly this is a labeling error, I have to assume the filmmakers wanted it this way.  The sound is clear and strong, but is not the surround generally expected.  I suspect the idea was to keep the sound in its basic format as it was made at the time.
The two characters seem to draw you in. There is a bit of good humor and fun interaction. I enjoyed it.

I heard a song from this play on the Tony awards on TV recently. I noticed that this play received 5 Tony awards, and I enjoyed the song, so I ordered the dvd. I was utterly disappointed with this production. Every other word spoken in several scenes is f_ _ _ (rhymes with duck). I found this to be so offensive that it totally negated any positive effects of the music. As for the music, several of the songs are more shouted than sung, and the music is dissonant and harsh rather than melodic, sweet and lyrical. I read the reviews for this play before ordering it, and no one even mentioned the offensive language! I would like to send this back to Amazon for a full refund. I wish that Amazon had a better method for completing reviews. If you had a specific question about the presence of obscenities, perhaps a kind soul would indicate this and save others the pain of purchasing a dvd that is offensive. I did not give this dvd any stars, since I believe it did not deserve any, but I was asked to rate it, and I did not know how to give it less than one star. Sincerely, Paula from Stony Point, NC

This movie was great- it didn't ask much of the viewer, just to sit back and enjoy this low-key romance. Transcendent harmonies, intriguing plotline, anonymous characters. .. for what more could one ask?

Disappointing that the movie plays fine but the extras are not watchable unless your player converts PAL.  I don't see where this is called out anywhere in the product description.  This is on a Sony BDP-S570
I bought the movie after seeing the play on Broadway opening night. Neither disappoints. The film won an Oscar. The play is up for numerous Tony Awards.

I rented this because I'd just been to see the musical "Once" on Broadway.  It's fun to see the original material the show was based on and get more insight into how the story was created.  It's hard to believe this isn't a true story--it just FEELS so true.  It's a very touching story, very believable.  I love the dynamic between the unlikely collaborators in music.  It's a simply made movie that will stay with you for a long time.  Highly recommended.

I fear I had quite forgotten this exquisite example of independent film making.  It came up in a search and I was a bit floored by my reaction to seeing it again.  Suffice it to say, the strength of my reaction caused me to buy it.

If you like movies with a good story, no explosions, excellent music, heartbreaking emotions and just plain enchantment, do yourself a favor and get this film.  No big names, no big action but a breathtakingly brilliant total package worthy of a Saturday night stay home date, just add take out.

I just watched Once one more time. I saw it the year it came out, based on the recommendations of several friends. Now five years later, I watched it again and got even more out of it. So much so, that I immediately purchased the soundtrack recording. (Not sure why I didn't the first time.)

Besides the great music by Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov, the evolving platonic love story between the two of them is incredibly refreshing in this day of meaningless sex. Here we have meaningful love, but in the end they both return to their former loves, even while knowing that something special has developed between the two of them.

What I didn't catch the first time is how the music in many places propels the plot forward. Even a line in the show given in Czech and never translated, gives a hint as to what's really going on.

This film is delightful, and the fact that the film is low budget adds to the innocent quality of whole thing: music, story and location. I mean, what's not to love about Dublin?

I watched this movie by chance on TV (in Germany) and bought the DVD the day after because I loved it so much. I think I have seen it a million times. Now I gave it as a present to a friend and she also loved it. Also my friends who were forced to watch it with me liked it.
Once is the cutest love story without even a kiss. It seems all so real and not acted out (probably because from my knowledge the characters are no actors and they became a real couple after the movie was made). I also really liked the music - I also bought the soundtrack ;) - and the Oscar for that is well deserved!

Since others have already said it all as far as what the story is all about I'll just add my vote here that I love this movie and think it deserves five stars and more. Once hits all the right notes in creating a feel that you are watching life unfold for the two characters that become friends and musically more. To me it seemed so very real, even more so than a documentary.

I shared this movie with my college age children and they really enjoyed it as well. The soundtrack is stunning and definitely worth owning if you enjoyed the movie.

Highly recommended.

This film "Once" has got to be one of the worst that I have viewed in years!  How John Carney, the writer/director was ever able to get this out into the market for sale, I do not know.  It is absolute trash and the players are terrible.  Thus music is absolute garbage.....far too loud and "grating" on the nerves!  Need I say more....or less.

I have two options:  Ask for a refund, or throw this DVD of "Once" right into the garbage!

Once (2006)
Drama, Music, Romance, 85 minutes
Directed by John Carney
Starring Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova

The opening scene in Once shows a guy (Hansard) busking. The song is unremarkable, but a few people like it and give him their change. Then, two minutes later, something incredible happens. We see the guy singing at night when the streets are virtually deserted. Although he's alone, he's pouring his heart out using his beaten up guitar and raspy voice.

I was hooked from that moment on.

When the guy looks up, there's a girl (Irglova) standing there listening. We never learn their names. It's as if the story is more important than the people in it. She gives him 10 cents and they begin talking. He works with his father in a vacuum cleaner repair shop and she has a vacuum cleaner in need of repair. When she brings it the following day, she treats it like a dog on a leash.

The two have lunch together and she takes him to a music shop where the owner allows her to play piano. When she plays a piece by Mendelssohn, the guy's jaw drops open in astonishment. She invites him to join her on his guitar and he teaches her how to play one of his songs. That's how they begin their friendship.

The setting is Dublin and life isn't easy. The guy and the girl don't have much money. But what does shine through is the Irish sense of community. They love life and the people seem genuine and real. That description also applies to Once.

The film was shot on a budget of around 100,000 using two Handycam camcorders, but you'll quickly forget that and focus on the story.

The guy has broken up with his girlfriend and she has moved to London. The girl married at a young age, but her husband is back in the Czech Republic and has left her. So there's the possibility of romance and I won't ruin what happens for anyone who hasn't seen the film. What's even more important is their shared love of music. The two have a real connection and she wants to help him reach a wider audience by negotiating the use of a local music studio for the weekend.

There are two wonderful reactions later in the film. One comes from Eamon, who is an audio technician at the studio; the other comes from the guy's dad when the guy plays him a CD.

The special features mention that over half the film is told through the use of song, but this is not a musical. The songs never make you step outside the story and they come across as totally natural. As well as music, there's plenty of dry humor, but the story is mainly about relationships and pursuing your dreams.

Once is one of the most heartwarming stories that I have ever seen. The song Falling Slowly won the Oscar for best song and Hansard and Irglova have toured under the name The Swell Season. It just goes to show that you don't need to spend millions in order to make a film that touches people, and this touched me more than most.

In a world which rewards artists with the right look and a manufactured sound, it's refreshing to see people with real passion succeed.

The UK Blu-ray is region free, although the special features are audio only unless you use a region B or region free player.

This is a great film for musicians, getting a glimpse into the collaborative energy of the creative process.
Blu-Ray menus for extras do not work in my newer Sony player, which is why I dropped rating to 4 stars.
I can live with it, though, as I loved the film!

If you love music, simple storytelling, have a heart and a soul, you will love this film.  So incredibly moving and stirring. The people in this film touched me so deeply...I can't even call them characters because I felt as though I was watching real people having an experience in their lives. A standing ovation to the two singer/song writers/ musicians and director.  An absolute gem of a film.
It takes a few minutes to get used to the rather heavy brogue.  I look forward to the Broadway version!
The music is great. This guy get's permanently friendzoned in this charming movie about people we can't have who we long for. Every guy will related to this movie, the acting is great.

For those that have played music for a living, originals band, Top 40, whatever ya did, or just wanted to, maybe you did some studio sessions too, you'll get it. For the younger boys and girls, just a love story, music is just the way to get there. Sidenote to the those that did studio work. In the USA, did that; UK folks, I'm guessing it was the same, the recording engineer is perfect, you'll get it mates :-) A romantic comedy, minus the sentimentality, just gave it as a gift to a good friend...neither of us live in the past, just a nice reminder of what it was... Worth watching, some girls, they get it too ... jb
This is one of the best films I have seen in ages. Beautiful visuals, solid and provocative plot, great chemistry and oh the music! I never wanted it to end.

The original shipment was lost in the mail. When I regestered a complaint, a replacement copy was immediately
provided. Thanks. Since "Once" is going to Broadway, as a musical, I wanted to see the original movie. It was enjoyable.

I wanted to submit this review for other buyers...  This movie is outstanding!  And I received an original recording, no problems at all with the DVD!  I will buy again from this seller!  Thank you so very much!!  --RACE GIRL

Without a US release of Once on Blu-Ray, this region-free Blu-Ray from the UK is a good substitute. The picture quality is fantastic and the best reason to upgrade to the Blu-Ray from the DVD, or to buy the Blu-Ray over the DVD. As for the audio quality, I was a little disappointed that the Blu-Ray did not feature an upgraded audio mix from the stereo mix on the DVD; this is quite likely that the original theatrical release was only a stereo mix, but it would have been nice for a little upgrade in audio quality.

Some previous reviews noted that the additional content did not play for them on this UK release - I had no problems playing the bonus material. It is likely that the bonus material is in the PAL format used in Europe as opposed to NTSC used in the states, and if so then it is probably and issue with not all Blu-Ray players and/or HDTVs being compatible with that format.

As for price, definitely buy from one of the other sellers of NEW copies on Amazon - half the price for the same Blue-Ray.

I just received my Once Blu Ray in Utah, and the picture quality is incredible, byt the audio is even better. I LOVE THIS MOVIE, and having the blu ray completes my life. Thanks to those across the Atlantic who made this possible, and super affordable.

I recently saw this movie and it goes up there with one of my all time favorites.  It takes a unique twist on the "boy meets girl" dynamic.  If you want to make it comparable to another script it is part Music and Lyrics and part Before Sunrise, but truly this movie stands on it's own.

What makes this movie outstanding outside of the phenomenal soundtrack (which are all ORIGINAL songs for this movie ...when was the LAST time you can say that about a contemporary movie??) is the beautiful portrayal of the touching relationship between the man and woman.  For a moment it borders on the clich romance but their relationship connects more on the creative level.  Watching these two develop music together is nothing short of magical.  It gave me chills to see how each other's talents just blossomed when they were working together.  The music is unbelievably good.  The lyrics are heartbreaking and the piano and guitar and the harmonizing voices are fantastic.  I was reminded of Joan Biaz, Bob Dylan and Simon and Garfunkel while listening ...again though the comparisons aren't quite right ...it's that different.

What I also love is the subtle realism of this movie.  It doesn't have the flashy lights or the BIG dramatics or the drop dead gorgeous actors who hair and make up is so perfect that they look good from any angle.  It was shot creatively but felt almost like a documentary.  It allows you to connect with the situations deeper than any movie.  For example, when the girl was walking the streets up late b/c she just had to finish getting her thoughts down for a song, I was instantly transported back to so many nights when I did that writing down thoughts for papers at college or when I had to figure out my thoughts for a personal conflict and was compelled to walk until I finished.  Everything about the situation felt genuine, from the way she emptied out every remote in the house to how she ran out to the corner store in those ridiculous slippers.  I understood her character on a level I normally don't when watching a movie.

I would be remiss not to mention the music again.  I had never heard of either of these artists before watching this movie.  However I didn't feel like it was an unabashed attempt at self promotion.  The story was just as exceptional as the music.
If you are looking for a good STORY, wonderful ACTING and excellent MUSIC this is the flick for you.  However, if you are into cheap thrills, flashy car chases, and huge overblown drama ...it probably won't do a thing for you.

I absolutely loved this movie.  Right after it finished I ran into my basement and started working on my own songs with my guitar.  I just wish I could write songs like this guy and girl!  I checked out the credits because i didn't even know that the movie's stars are the actual songwriters and obviously performers.  I also noticed acting credits said "the guy" and "the girl"- I didn't even realize that they had no names until the end credits.

The existing reviews give good movie summaries, so i'll just point out a few of my favorite scenes.  Well, to start with I'm obsessive about watching the beginning of a movie- if I miss the beginning I don't want to see it.  Because the beginning is usually the best part- well I loved how art and commerce collide at the beginning when the street singer is robbed of his few dollars while he's singing, by another street person and then chases the robber through the streets- funny stuff.  Then I loved how after the "girl and guy" meet, she brings her vacuum cleaner so he can fix it and she rolls it down the street like she's was walking a dog!  Hilarious.  Then the couple visit a music store and she gets on the piano and he teaches her a new song of his and I was just overcome by this scene.  I think that girls cry when they're young and that guys start crying when they get older- because I just started tearing up!  I don't even know these people but I was overwhelmed by the beauty of the music.  I thought at that moment-- that is what music is- its love, its sex, its beautiful.  Music is magic and this scene was magic.

I also liked how she lived with her mother and they didn't have a phone and their neighbors came by to watch tv because they were the only tenants in the building with a television.  Well i tell you, there isn't one phony moment in this whole film.  And you keep waiting for the big kiss or the sex scene like most Hollywood movies, but it never happens.  The girl and guy share a love or friendship through music that didn't need to consummate into romance.  Although you keep hoping it does!  Amazing movie!

I loved this movie when I saw it in the theater, and wanted to own a copy.  It's a one-of-a-kind musical, totally original and a little quirky, not predictable.  The music is terrific and the acting is totally natural.  I recommend it to anyone who loves good music and complex characterizations.

Blu-ray picture is clear and beautiful, much better than the theatre print I saw in 2007.  Despite the improvement, film has not lost any of its naturalness; like we are evesdropping on real people.  John Carney's decision to ask his musical talent, unproven as actors, to be the movie; that was a great call.

I first found this movie on Netflix  and after watching it I  knew I had to own it. It touched me personally.  It is the story of a simple friendship between a broken-hearted vacuum cleaner repairman / street musician and a young immigrant single mother who loves to play  piano and sings beautifully.  The actors wrote all the music for the film and this was the female leads first venture into acting.  The fact that it is set in Dublin Ireland first drew me to the film. I liked the music so much I downloaded the soundtrack from Amazon before I bought the movie.  It will make you smile.

Some day people will hear the anthemic ballad "Falling Slowly" and have absolutely no idea that it formed the emotional core of the most beloved film of the 2000s.

It's just that good a song...it really is.

Of course, there will also be future-cinephiles that discover John Carney's lovely music-film ONCE and find themselves awed by the discovery of so gorgeous a paean to romantic love tucked away in such an unassuming little Irish indie.

Indeed, ONCE is a film that most of us fell very quickly for, actually.

ONCE succeeds largely on the shoulders of its powerhouse songs...co-written and performed by its two stars, Glen Hansard and Markta Irglov. There is a story of course...two lonely souls fall in love while making beautiful music together...but make no mistake, ONCE is more concerned with connecting its relational dots with sweet melody, not pitch-perfect plotting.

In addition to the aforementioned "Falling Slowly," other standout songs/scenes include the heart-pounding opening number "Say It to Me Now," the soaring "When Your Mind's Made Up," and the most heartbreaking break-up ballad ever, "Lies."

I don't think I've ever seen a film that makes me feel more human, more hopeful, more loved...than John Carney's ONCE.

If you are someone who regularly seeks out subtle, sophisticated, truthful films that avoid cliches, then you probably already know about "Once."  If you don't, then you can't see it soon enough.

But if you have been walking out of the big-budget, mainstream movie offerings at the local 36 screen Mondoplex feeling vaguely dissatisfied, thinking to yourself, "there must be something more," then "Once" is a great place to start finding that something more.

Pablo Picasso said, "Art is the lie that makes us understand the truth."  Believe it or not, there is a whole universe of artistic truth that is outside the walls of the shallow, predictable realm created by market studies and focus groups.  If you are ready to put your foot into deeper waters, you can't go wrong with "Once."

I'll let other people summarize the plot.  Let's just say that if you stick with it until they sit down at the piano together in the music store, you'll be with it until the end.
Excellent film by non-movie producers made with rented cameras and street actors, a true gem of a film. Music won Oscar for best song, the sound track is amazing, as is the story.

I heard the soundtrack before ever seeing the movie.  I heard "Falling Slowly" on the public radio and heard a lot of talk about the movie.  When Swell Season came locally for a concert, I had to sit down and watch to movie.

I'm so glad Amazon had it on demand.  I could not find it anywhere!  No rental place had it, no store had it for me to buy.  Amazon really came through so I could download it and watch it.

I love the story and the music throughout.  You can really see the chemistry between the two leads, no wonder they had a relationship outside of the movie.

Oh, and you have got to love Glen Hansard's accent!

With nearly 300 very enthusiastic reviews already on Amazon, normally I wouldn't bother adding just one more, but in this case I am.

I received the soundtrack for the movie and played it over and over again.  I listened to the melodies, the lyrics, and absolutely enjoyed it every time it was played. An easy five star rating for the music.  So, I then almost anxiously got a copy of the DVD and was ready to be carried away by a modern day "musical".

As the movie unfolded ....
it was obvious that the movie was a vehicle for the music and not the other way around.  Normally, this would be fine if a) the script was good, b) the acting was fair, or c) if the production was such that it created the charm of the music.  If you watch the Extra Features, the director proudly says that he started with a sixty page script and he didn't want to overcomplicate the project with the pressure of overinvestment.  I can certainly appreciate why someone might feel that way, but the overall story just missed.  First, the songs don't tell the story of the characters very well and in some cases they down right contradict what's presented in the movie.  This is what happens when a script is thrown together using some extremely talented musicians without any acting experience.  I certainly don't fault the main characters, but they simply didn't pull off their parts with many lines being choppy and unconvincing.  There was no real flow or continuity just pronouncements about what was coming next and the reaction of the actors to those pronouncements.  So, all in all, the soundtrack set a bar for the movie that was so high that it was not going to work unless they really attempted to mold the movie more closely to the lyrics of the songs.

I can see why this won awards at Sundance ...
if you never heard the music and just sat back and treated it like a very rough indy movie, you'd be carried away by the music missing that the acting was both forgivable and forgetable.  But unfortunately, the movie, the direction, the many occurences when a scene didn't work and when they should have reshot (assuming the director knew to reshoot ... maybe he didn't) just made the movie clumsy and awkward ... something like the main characters.  Perhaps there's some beauty in that, but it is clearly a case of lost potential with such a beautiful soundtrack primarily written by Glen Hansard.

In case you're interested in the story ...
it's a boy meets girl in Dublin, he plays music, she plays music, they play music together.  Reality and history ulitmately set in and the rest you can find out by watching the movie (or reading another review that has a spoiler in it).

So I highly recommend ...
buying the CD ... listening to it a million times ... borrow the video and watch it Once (no pun intended) ... and if you really think that it rivals Brief Encounters or has the charm of similar movies (non-musical) like Before Sunrise, maybe even purchase it.

STELLAR movie...This is for the romantics of either sex.....Beautiful story of two people meeting and the effect it had on their lives.....A must see for those that are not only romantic but have a sensibility about life...PS, if you love music you will love the songs in this one.
What can I say about this movie? It's simple yet poignant. The music moves the story forward and what beautiful music it is...
Sure and this filum is just as good as it was said to be and that's pretty good indeed.
The actors and actresses were adorable, the music was amazing, but I thought the storyline was mediocre. There wasn't too much point to it.

Wow - what a disappointment! I bought this based on all of the positive reviews - I hate to be the pundit, but the film came across as a very amateur concoction both from the filming and dialog perspectives. It failed to garner our interest or attention. After 30 minutes of dribble we finally shut it off and watched a real movie. Not recommended.
A feel good movie, and keeps you feeling good from begining to end.  Not many movies can do that!
I think this is such a cute movie.  It's kind of slow, yes...but the fact that the people in it are actually the people who sing the songs is awesome and the story is cute too :)
Just a beautiful movie with beautiful music and characters you will fall in love with . . .

I wasn't sure what to expect with this movie. Like many, I've heard the theme song over and over and covered many times. I really liked it and the reviews on the movie were good. So I picked up a used copy.

It was wonderful. So unlike most American movies, it was unique, unpredictable and heartwarming.

The two leads are well played, raw, honest and never seemed like 'acted' roles.
There is quite a bit of adult language though so it is not for the younger crowd. The actor's heavy accents can also get in the way of comprehension but for the most part are understandable.

Besides the music being great, the relationship between "guy" and "girl" (you never know their names) is terrific. They both hold their own ground and play on each other well. They are a great compliment to each other. "Guy" is rough, angry and struggling. "Girl" is softer, motherly, and friendly.

One of my favorite scenes is "girl" walking around town pulling her vacuum along like a pet, in the hopes that "guy" can fix it.

Despite the cover photo, this is not really a romantic love story. But the tension is there nonetheless.

Well worth a watch.
Incredible music and beautiful story. One of the best films I've seen in a long time.

All of these one star reviews must be into Transformers or A-Team movies.  This movie is real from start to finish.  So much background to the filming, the truth in character for both Guy and Girl.
You will not forget the feeling of this movie.  Could not recommend more.
Everything ok. The movie came fast and it's one of the best I've ever watched. Hollywood should look at this kind of film and redefine its concepts.

I loved this film when I first saw it on DVD, particularly because of the excellent music. I was initially disappointed by the stereo only soundtrack of the DVD, so when I heard of a Blu-ray release with DTS-MA audio, I was really looking forward to a high quality, full surround presentation. I received the Blu-ray, put it in the PS3, AND..... was again disappointed by 2 channel audio! The back of the disc is marked "Dolby Digital 5.1", "DTS Surround", and "DTS-HD Master Audio", but don't believe it. There are 3 audio tracks on the disc, 2 of which are director/cast commentaries, and all 3 audio tracks are DTS-MA 2 channel audio. Also, as indicated by the other reviews, I was unable to access any of the featurettes. On the plus side, the video quality is a big improvement over DVD.

Great movie! I watched "Once" in the theatre when it first came out, and loved it so much, that I told everyone I knew back then who could really appreciate a smart movie, to see it. Now I own it can see it and share it whenever I want.

Movie was wonderful..the music was incredible..intensity and feeling  in the music and a poignant story as well.  My only problem was that the CD that was suppose to be in the box was missing but Amazon solved that issue to my satisfaction in a very professional and proper manner!

I wish I had opportunity to view this movie before purchasing - never would've bought it. I rely on user reviews. I was stung this time. I didn't see any story line and the music is not that good. Chalk this up to a lesson learned. I'll be lucky if I can give it away.

What an awful, amateurish, unwatchable video.  Aside from the bad singing, bad songs and unintelligible accents, there were the uninteresting characters and the jerky hand-held camera used throughout.

I frequently buy books and movies that seem interesting and have good user reviews.  As I like musicals and this is five-star rated, it seemed like a no-brainer.  What a mistake!  Maybe the film makers have nothing better to do with their time than to post fake reviews.  From now on I'm going to be more suspicious of high ratings that don't correspond to box-office success.

I first saw this movie at a friend's apartment two years ago and had never heard of it at the time. I remember thinking, man, this movie is going to suck, after watching the first ten minutes because it was kind of slow. But the second the first song was sung, I was completely hooked, and by the end I was almost cheering it was so good (it had been awhile since I'd seen a REALLY good movie). I don't know how to explain why this movie is so good besides the fact that it is so REAL. The cast is fantastic, the storyline has a nice twist to it, and the music, oh the music. This movie contains some of the most raw musical performances I've ever seen, Glen Hansard sings with so much emotion you're on the edge of your seat every time. I bought this movie on DVD and basically gave it to everyone I know this Christmas. So far, everybody (and it was a rather diverse group) has loved it. I could watch it all day.
This is an absolutely beautiful movie.  Extraordinary music and characters.  A movie about the music.

Found a copy of this movie in Iraq while deployed there with the Army.  I used to be a Czech linguist; I have travelled to Ireland; and I play the guitar and sing (though not as well as Glen Hansard)...so the cover description caught my interest.  I had no idea what a charming story I was in for.

Previous reviews have already given away too much of the story, all I can do is recommend it highly to anyone who appreciates independent films, quirky singer/songwriter tunes, sympathetic characters, cute girls, and realistic romance stories.  Watch this movie, and then watch it again.
Very chill movie, don't watch this when you're full of energy. Watch it on a lazy day.

How refreshing to see a film that doesn't have the obligatory sex scene thrown in, just for the hell of it, or because it's what people expect to see in a guy/girl movie.  I'm not a prude or anything, I just get tired of the standard hook-up that doesn't add a thing to the movie. Not that the guy doesn't make a move on the girl ... as he mentioned, in his apology to her, he had been very lonely, and she's gorgeous.  This movie is so low-key that my attention drifted from time-to-time, but that is not a drawback, it is simply a stylistic choice that fit the storyline well.  The music is enchanting, as are the scenes of the Irish countryside.

Since Once is only available in the US on DVD, I purchased the blu-ray through Amazon UK for less (including delivery) than most blu-ray and some DVD movies cost in the US.  The package arrived at my home in about a week with standard delivery.  It shipped through Royal Mail and was delivered by the US Postal Service.

Consistent with reviews I had read online before purchasing:  the movie played flawlessly, but the extra features did not work.  I was prepared for this outcome and am pleased to have the film in HD. As expected, the picture quality is clearly superior to the DVD version. I have seen some report their blu-ray unit is able to play the extra features.  I have not seen reviews stating the movie does not work.  I'm using a Sony BDP-S350 blu-ray player with up-to-date firmware.

Note:  at the writing of this review a US version of the blu-ray is not available.  If you purchase through any US reseller, it will be an imported version.

As for the film itself, the story is grounded and simple--yet remarkably interesting.  The music is absolutely gripping.  I typically hate musicals, but this is not your typical musical.  This ultra-low budget film deserves the nearly perfect score it's tallied on the Rotten Tomatoes website.  As a bonus for me, it was filmed in fantastic Dublin City where I have many fond memories from business trips.

REALLY enjoyed this different, fun, bittersweet, movie.  A bit like those old Judy Garland "let's go out in the barn and put on a musical," a bit like "Singles."

Rented the movie, then bought it to add to the permanent collection.

Also bought the soundtrack and the extended version of the "Strict Joy" album.

First let me say that this is one of the best low budget films ever made.  It looks great on Blu-ray.  Instead of buying it for $30 plus shipping from these Marketplace sellers, go to the bottom of this page and click on Amazon UK.  I got my copy there for a little over $15 USD which even included shipping from England!
This is one of the best the movie i have ever watched. I have also ordered its sountrack from Amazon. A masterpiece.
The movie itself was great.  The music in the movie was wonderful.  So wonderful in fact, I bought the soundtrack on itunes.

When Two Worlds Collide-Updated October 2013

Everybody, everybody who lives in cities, or who takes public transportation to the city has seen some straggly, snarling, struggling guy playing guitar, playing it well or poorly but playing it to rise above the din of city noises, and singing. Singing covers of some popular tunes, some tunes which will get we damn busy heads down travelers already late for something to listen up for a minute. Singing and strumming, well or poorly, but always with an open guitar case in for the "thank you kindly" donation that allows him to survive, to breathe, to write his lonely ballads, and to keep the wolves (read: landlord and other bill collectors) from his door. What you probably didn't know, unless of course you are among the seven people in the world who still listens to and supports folk music, roots music, street music or whatever you want to call it,  that those nameless guys (and gals) have stories to tell. Have the usual array of problems and dreams like the rest of us.

Problems like love, marriage, kids, lost ones, and dreams of making it off the streets and into the music studios and then... That back story, both the problems and the dream parts, are what drives this film under review, Once, about the connection, for a moment in time as it turned out, between a guy street musician in Dublin (that`s in Ireland for the heathens and an immigrant girl wannabe musician (immigrant in the days when, for a minute, Ireland stopped being a place to get bloody well out of going across the sea to Liverpool or across the pond to Amerikee and was a place to go to for dreams).

Under normal circumstance such a boy meets girl saga, would seemingly pose no problems for them getting together. There would almost have to be (and was) a natural attraction. But that is where the back story gets complicated, complicated just like for the rest of us. First off the guy was still pining away for his muse-girlfriend (Irish) who betrayed him with another lover and who was off in London. Secondly the girl, a Czech national, was married, married with a child, a little girl, (and with a mother in tow) whose estranged husband is back in the Czech Republic. What draws them together is the love of music. His rough-hewn plainsongs of sorrow and lost and her more delicate wistful attempts to make sense of a world through song (and piano) that is kind of passing her by.

But to the music, the all- consuming music that is really the star of this film since a great deal of its time is spent with the pair alternately flirting and creating something like a demo CD to shop around in order to get their big break, the one that will right their lives. That music, which by the way was written and sung by the actors who played the boy and girl (Glen Hansard and  Marketa Irglova), gets a lot of work-out here as he or she will burst into song at command. But in the end the two worlds, the world of the muse-driven (and career-driven as well) Irishman and a young immigrant woman looking for a father for her daughter as well as the music just couldn't mix, couldn't stand the huge effort to put those two worlds together. Couldn't stand the collision. As so they went their separate ways.  How is that for a back story of that straggly, snarling, struggling guy you see at that subway stop every workday morning.

Original Review

This is a quirky film. No question. It provides a very interesting twist in today's international multi-cultural society on the standard boy meets girl theme, and in Dublin no less. It also provides a quirky look at a subject that has always interested me, the trials and tribulations of trying to make ends meet while one is waiting to get one's big chance on the musical scene.

As for the boy (Glen Hansard) meets girl (Marketa Irglova)part the two, a strong but sensitive Irish lad trying to go from busker (street singer) to the limelight and a displaced Czech gal (with child and mother in tow) trying to make it on her own in up and coming modern day "Irish Tiger" (at least up until the last couple of years) Dublin. The glue that puts them together?  Well, she just happens to be something of a muse- and apparently classically- trained at that. This one and one half hour film centers on that musical collaboration, the possible budding romance between the two, the baggage and drag of their previous lives and something of a surprise at the end. All the while they are making beautiful music together, really just the music folks (for the most part, although some of his singing is a little over the edge for my tastes). What no over-the top, no gratuitous violence to save a fair damsel in distress, no ironic detachment under the stress of modern living?  No. I told you this was a quirky movie.

Wonderful movie. Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova are great as so
are the songs the perform. Loved the message abour pursuing one's
dreams no matter the obstacles. Very nice to watch enjoying good
company and a bottle of wine.
Still, I paid for two-day delivery and didn't get it on time.
I haven't receive a refund from Amazon, as promised on it's
delivery waranty.

This movie comes as close as any I have seen to what it is like to make music with other musicians. The scene in the music store is a perfect example of those rare moments when two people sit down to play for the first time and "magic" happens. The scene toward the end of the film when the musicians leave the recording studio in the early morning hours captures the essence of recording music perfectly. Unlike some of the other reviewers I liked the fact that they relationship between the Guy and the Girl did not follow the typical Hollywood arc. Another refreshing departure from the standard movie musical was the relationship between the Guy and his father. The music is a matter of taste. I happened to like it and understand that street musicians cannot deal in subtleties; they have to grab the audience by the throat. This movie's other achievement it to reimagining the musical in a more realistic way, and on that level it is a triumph. The music is more organic and not artificially injected into the story. The fact that it was done on an incredibly low budget shows that the concept and story matter more than anything else in making a great film. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I love this movie it was one of the best and rarest movie out there that actually show you what a really good movie one can make. And this is how music should really sound like and be about something that should come from the heart and make you feel in your soul like I said must watch!!!

I had to see the film after hearing "Falling Slowly" on AI.  Glen Hansard and Marketa Irglova are unspoiled musicians who make amazing music both separately and together.  I love the simple style in which the film was shot, spotlighting the sweet honesty of life for these two characters - named "girl" and "guy".  Don't be put off by the F-word in the beginning.  In other countries it's more of a typical vocabulary word than in the states.  If you love music and good story lines, you should really see this.  At least ONCE.  : )

Simply great and for under $10 you can't go wrong. The whole reason I found out about the movie was due to the Pandora website. A lot of songs kept coming up from it, and I loved them all before I finally realized that it was a movie. Watched it tonight, blew me away. A must own.

This is, by far, the most uplifting movie I've seen in a really long time. The two characters are depicted as incredibly realistic, yet magical. Perfect friendship/date movie, especially if you are both into "real" music. I highly recommend it!
Once Unusual but interesting movie. The music and spirit were great, the story line a bit unclear...

Great songs and a fun story that has romance, but isn't overly so.  It isn't a "chick flick".  It's also funny at times too.  It's part drama, part comedy, part romance, part inspiration about pursuing your dreams.

Get the movie and and the album!
This movie is wonderful... Glen Hansard rips your heart out right from the start with his incredibly passionate music. I recommend it to anyone who loves music, movies, love stories and tragedy!
a cool story of love, music, coming of age, all to the soundtrack of the awesome band the swell season! give it a try!

This is a movie that has to be seen for the first time on the big screen, not the small one.  One simply can't "get" the feel and deliciously slow pace of this film over a TV in the den.  It's an indie, small budget, artsy movie, and despite how it's billed, it's not a musical.  If you don't like artsy movies, or most indies, then you wouldn't like this one, either -- because it moves at its own pace and develops the story very slowly.  Kind of like enjoying a romantic, several course meal over several hours in an exotic location, rather than popping down a steak at Outback.  I loved it precisely because it was not sweet and sugary, but savory and a bit salty.
